general.headline: Get more PPC leads for your business ► PeterGuiliano Local Business Marketing
general.description:
★LION★ ADD ★ ME ☛ linkedinlion.xxs@gishpuppy.com ★

According to industry analysis, more than 90% of PPC accounts are not even checked from one week to the next. If that's your account, then you are paying too much for clicks. 

Worse than that, you probably send your costly traffic to your home page!

Simple, regular attention to best practice will likely double the results of your PPC.

If I can help you, I am very happy to do so. 

It shocks me to see so much online marketing, and especially pay per click advertising, being done so badly. 

Big brands can afford expensive AdWords management firms who know how to do it the right way and who constantly test and tune PPC campaigns for ever improving results.

But there are surprising numbers of PPC agency ripoffs collecting fees for doing nothing.

Proper pay per click management demands ongoing attention and up-to-date intelligence. To get the best results from your pay per click ads, you need to be fine tuning keyword selection and rejection so that you are only paying for clicks that give you results. Not paying for clicks that never deliver profits.

If you are currently running your own campaigns and think they could be boosted, I'm happy to give you some free advice. It doesn't matter where you are, all we need is time to connect via Skype.

I don't need your login details because you can share your screen with me and I can give you some ideas you can use or not — it's up to you. You will need to speak English, unfortunately.

Due to a partnership with the top US Local Business PPC marketer with Intellectual Property on what works best in the US, I am keen to find:

 ✓ A business hungry for big profit leads and ready to ramp up with techniques proven to work.

 ✓ A LOCAL BUSINESS COMMITTED TO ADWORDS  — looking to get full value from their PPC budget and looking to expand as soon as they see these methods work. 

►Call or email me at: linkedinlion.xxs@gishpuppy.com

general.description:
I am now the owner of Rotman & Morris, having enjoyed a 15 year partnership with my partner and mentor Alan Rotman who retired after 35 years of legal practice. Since 2011, I now have 4 suburban law offices with 20+ staff.

We have built up one of bayside and the peninsula’s most prominent suburban law firms servicing all mainstream areas of law, and providing professional and friendly service and advice at a reasonable cost.

In 2014 we opened an office in Dromana on the Mornington Peninsula, in 2015 we opened an office in Caulfield and in 2018 an office in Ripponlea. We now have 8 solicitors and  6 conveyancing clerks working for the firm.

Covering a range of legal areas including property leasing and conveyancing, commercial law, wills probate & powers of attorney, litigation and debt collection, we are able to provide you with commercially minded legal advice based upon a sound understanding of the law. Our clients are guaranteed personal attention in all their legal matters.

Whatever your legal requirements, large or small we will either be able to deal with you directly, or refer you  to other professionals in whom we have great confidence.

We do not charge on a time basis, and the majority of our services are provided on a fixed fee basis.

Yes we are on online, but we are also human so you can contact us by phone or in person at any of our suburban law offices.

jobs.description:
Rotman & Morris has recently grown to establish an additional business called Commercial Property Leases. 

There are 4 reasons why you should use Commercial Property Leases:
 
Cost: Why pay thousands of dollars for the preparation of a legal document? We offer fixed price leasing so it won’t cost a 4tune!
 
Efficiency: Why risk losing a commercial tenant because your solicitor takes such a long time to prepare the lease? We will endeavour to provide draft documents within 48 hours of receiving required information, and original leases within 24 hours of payment and your approval!
 
Legally Binding: Lawyers don’t have experience selling properties or advertising for tenants, and real estate agents are not legally qualified to prepare legally binding documents! Why not 4get about the worry of preparing the legal documents required, and leave it to our legal team!
 
Easy to Use: Landlords, Agents or even solicitors can provide instructions 4 any lease matter using our simple application form. No need to leave your desk or business! No cost for any reasonable communication with our team of lawyers during business hours, or email us 24/7 on any current file!

I completed my Articles with Alan Rotman & Associates under Alan's guidance, and it

It all began in 2009 when Annette and Jeff Sharp, two committed and passionate individuals from diverse but complementary backgrounds came together. We united over 30 years of experience in the tourism and communications industries, both here and abroad, including working with some of Australia’s biggest and best-known tourism and communications companies, including Australian Pacific Tours, AAT Kings Tours, Accor Asia Pacific, Great Southern Railway, Publicis, WPP and the Grollo Group of Companies.

The Itours Australia dream grew from our own touring company that carried mainly Asian and European clients. We were desperate for translated language guides for our non-English speaking visitors but were limited by poor quality or high costs … or both! So we got designing and developed our own self-guided audio tours, had them translated into five languages and distributed on iPods.
They were an instant success and the uptake was a staggering 100%. Asian language translations proved most popular, and after further research we created Itours Australia and took the concept to market.

Initially distribution was through MP3 and MP4 players, but this has since evolved to include podcasts, mobile applications and downloadable files on websites.
In a few short years, we have evolved into a business that can help clients convey their story in whatever language required and build their business to be ready and able to service the growing Chinese market.

Fairtrade organisation.  Coffee, tea, chocolate and other goods.
The Fair Trade concept is an international movement that aims to ensure producers in developing  countries get a fair deal for their products. Producers of crops such as coffee, tea, cocoa and rice are paid a fair price and offered long-term contracts to guarantee a sustainable livelihood.

TiE Melbourne is a non-profit organisation dedicated to fostering conscious entrepreneurship in the state of Victoria, Australia. It is one of the many chapters of the spectacular TiE global network. And like with all these other chapters, at the core of TiE Melbourne is a group of  Charter Members - Experienced entrepreneurs and business professionals who wish to "give back" in gratitude for their success, chiefly by acting as mentors for those who are starting out on their entrepreneurial journeys.

The Charter Members of TiE Melbourne strongly believe that:
1. Promoting entrepreneurhip is the single most important item on the agenda to sustain Australia's economic success
2. Long term entrepreneurial success comes with core values of integrity, selflessness and compassion
3. Entrepreneurs can and must craft lives that balance wealth generation with maintaining good health of body, peace of mind, and fulfilment of spirit  

Activities of TiE Melbourne:
1. Engaging and informative monthly networking and education events
2. One-on-one mentoring by Charter Members of Members
3. TiECon Australia once every two years - a major one-day conference show-casing the values of TiE
4. Half-day entrepreneur skills development workshops

general.headline: Director, Registry Operations at Victorian Cytology Service
general.description:
Genevieve Chappell is an experienced senior manager having held numerous service delivery and operations roles in acute, non-acute, public and private health settings for more than 20 years.  

With a strong interest in population health and cancer screening, Genevieve has managed registries and data services since 2000.  Prior to joining VCS in 2008, as the Director of Operations for BreastScreen Victoria, Genevieve  managed three key support services, the Registry, Information Services and the Quality, Research and Planning units.  Other positions held include Manager, Health Information Services, The Royal Melbourne Hospital and Health Information Advisor.

As the Director, Registry Operations for VCS, Genevieve oversees the operations of the Victorian Cervical Cytology Registry (VCCR); National HPV Vaccination Program Register (NHVPR); South Australian Cervix Screening Register (SACSR) and Victorian Participant Follow Up function (PFUF) for Bowel Cancer Screening.  

Supporting the Cervical and Bowel Cancer Screening Programs in Victoria and South Australia, and the HPV Vaccination Program nationally, Genevieve leads an experienced and dedicated team of nearly 40 staff in the delivery of registry services, including contact centre and mail services, data management, reporting and quality, monitoring and follow up services and stakeholder liaison and management.  

With a strong background in health information management Genevieve is committed to ensuring the delivery of high quality registry and data services, to support program delivery and management, which exceed stakeholder expectations.

general.headline: Director, Employee Relations Consultant, Conflict Resolution Expert at The Zalt Group.
general.description:
I have a little secret; don’t tell anyone, but conflict is more positive than people think!!

With a background in law, employee relations, industrial relations and diversity, I understand workplace issues intimately.  Known for my creative and transparent approach to problem-solving, I challenge the status quo and question limitations. 

I’ve been described as compassionately confronting.  Here are some of my career highlights so far: 
•	Giving back time, energy and productivity to individuals and organisations through successful 
        grievance management and conflict resolution.
•	Mediating conflict resolution for diverse sectors including education, manufacturing, retail, FMCG, 
        client services and government.
•	Changing Toyota’s industrial relations culture to one of employee relations – influencing senior 
        internal and union management to think differently and relate to each other more positively and 
        relate to each other more positively.
•	Being invited to be an Associate with the prestigious Triad Group of consultants of Harvard 
        academics.
•	Acting as a Restorative Engagement Facilitator for the Defence Abuse Response Taskforce.
•	Establishing a Diversity Program for Berri Ltd.
•	Coaching individuals and organisations to manage their working relationships effectively, including 
        HR professionals, supervisors, business owners and Boards.

But career highlights are not always on a grand scale. One moment I’ll never forget is when a man I coached for a negotiation once told me, "You’ve taught me to use my words and not my fists"!!

     To diagnose the real issues and strengthen the long-term health of your workplace relationships, 
                                   CONTACT ME TODAY:  zandy.fell@thezaltgroup.com.au

jobs.description:
"There's nothing soft & fluffy about workplace relationships.  There is a strategic advantage"

At The Zalt Group, we provide practical advice and solutions to help resolve workplace conflict and issues. This includes: 
*Workplace Conflict, Resolution & Strategy*            *Facilitation, Training, Coaching & Speaking*
*Mediations & Investigations*                                  *HR & ER Advice*
*Workplace Healthchecks* 

Here are the reasons our clients continually choose to use us:

WE’RE COMFORTABLE IN UNCOMFORTABLE SITUATIONS
At The Zalt Group, we help people prepare for and participate in uncomfortable conversations every day. We’re intimately familiar with and comfortable in managing all types of people, organisational sensitivities and complex conflict.

WE GET THE DIAGNOSIS RIGHT: DIAGNOSIS DETERMINES SUCCESS
Accurate diagnosis is critical to the success of your outcome. That’s why we work so hard to understand the root cause of the issues plaguing your workplace before prescribing ways to remedy them (just like a good doctor would do)!!

WE'RE CREATIVE YET STRATEGIC
As legally trained professionals and conflict resolution practitioners, we work at the intersection of psychology and the law to achieve the best possible outcomes. We draw on proven conflict management principles and practices – but also recognise the long-term value of a more flexible, human approach.

WE GUIDE, SUPPORT AND EMPOWER
Although you engage us for our expertise and advice, we believe success ultimately lies with you. Rather than dictating a particular course of action, we present a range of options for you to consider, empowering you to make informed decisions that you believe in.

WE TAILOR SOLUTIONS
Steering clear of the cookie-cutter approach and one-size-fits-all mentality. We understand that your workplace is like no other – as are the problems that it may face. That’s why we follow processes to suit your people and the unique dynamics at play.
Negotiation Skills

Jason uses his expertise to free clients to think so that they can define and achieve their goals and aspirations - with a particular focus on governance, strategy and finance.

Jason is a senior business performance improvement executive and advisor to Boards and C level executives, with two decades of professional experience gained in both the Australian and European markets.  He has a proven ability to implement strategies that deliver value enhancements to a range of businesses.

Jason is an expert at improving business profitability and competitiveness to increase value. He uses his significant experience in strategy, governance and finance to create strong links between Vision, Strategy, Tactics and Performance/ Monitoring.

Jason’s critical point of difference is his ability to understand the complexities and uncertainties of the modern business world and markets.  He translates this insight into strategies to improve business performance and create value.

Going beyond insight, Jason works with clients to create the governance and finance frameworks to implement improvements to drive business performance.

Michael Dodge has extensive commercial law experience across the entire corporate lifecycle.   He has acted on the full range of fundraising transactions both debt and equity from seed and growth funding through to IPO.  Michael's experience also encompasses debt and equity transactions in secondaries markets.  Michael has also been involved in mergers, acquisitions and exits from investments through IPO and trade sales.

Michael's breadth of experience makes him ideally placed to work on corporate reconstructions, in which the entire capital structure (both debt and equity) is being reshaped.  Examples of Michael's work in this area include the reconstructions of Centro and Nine Entertainment which were both successfully returned to the ASX.
 
Michael has acted for companies across a broad range of market sectors including technology, retail, mining, property, industrials and infrastructure.

Michael has previously been noted in Legal Profiles, the independent review of Australian legal firms as being an “astute and commercially focused lateral thinker”.

general.headline: Rabbi at CJCC and Director at C Care

jobs.description:
Chabad Jewish Community Centre is part of an international organization on the front lines of Jewish education and activism. Now numbering over 3000 centers around the globe, Chabad provides care, inspiration, hospitality and knowledge to Jews from all walks of life. Our centre serves the Jewish Community of Docklands, Port Melbourne and South Melbourne. 

Under the guidance of the Lubavitcher Rebbe, Rabbi Menachem Mendel Schneerson, the organization has made "Ahavat Yisrael" - Love of a fellow Jew – the driving force that gives it momentum. Acceptance of every Jew on their own level, regardless of their background, observance, age or financial status, has become the trademark of Chabad.

CCare blurs the lines of social division and empowers individuals in distress or in need of support, giving them back their humanity.
Through C Care's many programs, ranging from Cookoffs and home visits to teen activities and clubs, volunteers build strong and lasting relationships with members and become a trustworthy, reliable and constant force of relief in their lives.

"EMPOWERING YOU TO LIVE DIFFERENTLY"

Qualified Wellness Coach

Integrating 25 years of physiotherapy experience with a Diploma in Coaching, Leadership and Mentoring and a Certification in Conversational Intelligence®, I address all aspects of mind and body in order to achieve optimal wellbeing and a healthy lifestyle. 
 
I enjoy working with individuals who are looking to create life long behavioural change around health goals such as increased fitness, weight management, decreased pain and stress reduction. I also work with teams incorporating the neuroscience behind our conversations to develop greater trust, deeper relationships and improved work outcomes.
 
I embrace living outside our comfort zones in order to live purposeful and fulfilled lives and as a triathlete and ultra marathon runner lead by example. 
 
As a co-founder and president of a grassroots charity, Bicycles for Humanity, Melbourne, I believe there is an important correlation between volunteering and health. 

As well as providing a standard method of consultation, my passion for exercise and fitness provides the opportunity for coaching sessions to be carried out whilst walking or running.

I look forward to helping you get On The Move :-)

I enjoy novel writing in my free-time and cuddling up with a book on cold nights, and, I absolutely adore the soft dulcet tones of Bob Dylan! I love helping others, and I find great pleasure in building relationships and communicating with people.

I am well versed in SEO, copywriting, blogging, and article writing.  I have also had plenty of experience using Microsoft applications, and for the most part, I know the Windows OS like the back of my hand.

general.description:
I could take this opportunity to tell you all about my previous 10 years experience in the Financial Services industry, but I know that what you really want to understand is how much I love helping people with their financial future. 

Providing wealth creation and wealth protection strategies for individuals and businesses is what I do best, and what I strongly believe in.

Did you know that the average Life and TPD cover held within an Australian Super Fund is only $95,000 (including the Super Balance) & the average mortgage in Australia is around $367,000? Im sure you don’t need to be a genius to work out based on these statistics that many Australians have a major problem if something was to happen to them. 

And this is where I come in – my mission is to help bridge the massive Underinsurance and Retirement funding gap that exists in Australia by helping one client at a time!

With my current role at NAB, I work with a number of referral partners to look after our clients financial planning needs. If like me you want to look after the best interests of your clients and want to help create wealth and protect your clients financially, then I would love to hear from you to discuss how we can form a reliable and professional referral arrangement. Together we can make a real difference to peoples financial lives – that’s what my job is all about…

This includes both personal and Business Risk Insurance in Life, Total and Permanent Disability, Trauma ,Income Protection and Business Expenses. My Goal is to ensure that clients have the correct amount of Insurance in place. It is well known that Australians are underinsured and we need to correct this.

How important is Growing Your  Wealth While
Protecting Your  Capital to you. Worthwhile considering!!.

Previously was a Director/Financial Planner with Churchill Morgan Global P/L-a boutique Financial Planning Organisation. Included KeyMan Insurance, Buy Sell Insurance and Shareholder Protection Insurance.
 
Whilst attending a conference in the United States I heard a fascinating discussion on the potential World War coming -the war between Young and Old. The old will be living longer with advances in modern medicine, they will not have enough savings to support themselves in retirement and will outnumber the young. The young will be losing their jobs to machines and there will only be 2 workers to support 1 welfare recipient and therefore taxes will go higher-not lower.
Therefore we need solutions and to look at supplementing people's cash flow if we are to solve these dilemmas.
This insight disturbed me as an innovative financial planner I wanted to source solutions for myself and clients. 
 with advances in modern medicine, they will not have enough savings to support themselves in retirement and will outnumber the young. 
Further more we have seen the results on savings of the GFC. We have now joined the Multi Billion Online Advertising Industry where the rewards are replacing an income or supplementing your Retirement savings

‣ Founder of VentureInk™ - an enthusiastic and energized team of experts ready to help you! We specialize in lead generation and eCommerce growth by helping clients self-publish books and create profitable marketing funnels on the back-end.

‣ Blogger, Author & YouTuber at The Big Venture - an online diary where I explore and share the successes and failures of my business ventures (and life learnings).

‣ Previous corporate experience in the New Business Incubation team at Telstra - focusing on new, growth areas that are aligned to the Telstra core business, e.g. Telstra Smart Home.

"Remember why you are. Life is only once, and slips by so smoothly that you can get away with coasting through a whole career and still look pretty good. Think about what you really want. Grasp it with unshakable passion and focused desire. Everything else is secondary."

jobs.description:
Bath Box® is an online Australian skin care & bath products retailer. We make and sell
      natural, luxurious, and handmade face masks, scrubs, lotions, bath bombs, and more.
      

    
      

    I co-founded Bath Box® in early 2017 with a small team and now manage everything
      growth-related, such as digital marketing, expansion into new markets, working with
      
      social media influencers, etc.

VentureInk™ is an enthusiastic team of experts specializing in lead generation and eCommerce growth by helping clients self-publish books and create profitable marketing funnels on the back-end. 

I have held a "CEO-type" position in VentureInk since the beginning, now managing a virtual team of over 10 staff located around the world. We have worked with clients across the globe and are now responsible for publishing over 400 books (digital, paperbacks, and audiobooks) that have sold a combined 1m+ copies through various channels such as Amazon, Audible, iTunes, Kobo, Barnes & Noble, etc.

The Big Venture is my online diary where I explore and share the successes and failures of my business ventures (and life learnings).  Highlights of my entrepreneurship background include:

‣ Launching and managing a successful eBay business; importing product from China and reselling in the Australian market [2009 - 2011].

‣ Creating over 20 micro-niche and affiliate marketing focused websites, and then flipping more than half of them profitably within the first year of creation [2010 - 2013].

‣ Founding a successful digital marketing agency that worked with entrepreneurs around the world to help them build websites and sell their products & services. Our focus was web development, graphic design, organic SEO, PPC advertising, niche research, keyword development, social media management, etc. [2011-2014]

‣ 2x best-selling Amazon author from writing and self-publishing two books - "eBay Selling" & "Debt-Free". Both books were leaders in their respective categories, Home Business and Personal Finance. They are now available in various formats on Amazon Kindle, Audible, iTunes, Barnes & Noble, Kobo, and more. [2014]

I was an integral part of our team that focused on the development of new, growth
      businesses, specifically the strategy and execution. The value I add is unique in a
      corporate environment and stems from my fast-paced, action-focused, entrepreneurial
      
      experience.

Rotation 1 - Innovation & Business Performance
Played a supporting role within team on two main procedural tasks; data retrieval from an internal database, and report building through SharePoint. Skills developed include: analysis of data, SQL report building, and web development.
Highlights include: Building the team website for the Intranet

Rotation 2 - Corporate Development, Strategic Finance
Played a supporting role to the team in various projects, and lead own projects with team members where necessary. Skills developed include company profiling, company valuation, stakeholder management, project management, and presentation skills.
Highlights include: Winning the Strategic Finance “ThinkBIG” challenge (similar to an internal SharkTank competition).

Rotation 3 - Fraud & Ethical Behaviour, Chief Risk Office

general.headline: CEO Internet Business Systems Australia
general.description:
David has had an association with the IT Service and Consulting
industry for nearly 30 years holding several high profile and influential positions. His experience embraces both the IT and Business sectors with a strong focus on Strategy, Design and Delivery.

Recently his focus has been in the areas Leasing, Lending, Case Management and Government Services, where there has been a strong need for real-world experience and analysis.

He has assisted organisations in Australia, New Zealand, Asia, Africa and Europe.

Specialties: David's experience is in the areas of Strategy, Commercial Management, Audit, Project Directorship and Issue Resolution, Software Engineering, Configuration and Integration solutions for Corporate Enterprise, Retail, Government and Financial Services clients.

jobs.description:
Internet Business Systems Australia offers extensive professional services covering various technical platforms to Large Corporate and Government Customers. 

A large part of our business focusses on Financial Services and assisting our clients to implement our market leading Leasing & Lending platform.

We are an industry leader in the provision of End-to-End solutions covering Strategic Consulting & Planning, Solution Design, Software Engineering & Delivery and Support and Managed Services.

IBSA holds memberships in: AIIA, Agile Alliance, IIBA, Software Innovation Forum and others.

David was appointed as one of four industry members of the Victorian Government eServices Working Party.  As an existing eServices panel member, IBSA are pleased with David’s appointment, and feels that their contribution is valued and appreciated. David commented: "We look forward to working with Government to improve the efficacy of Government Procurement. We are excited about the benefits that this will provide to both Industry and Government".

The Baillieu Government established  the Working Party under authorisation of the Assistant Treasurer to provide advice to the Minister on the operation of the current  Whole of Victorian Government eServices Panel arrangement with a view to providing advice on a potential future construct and model for the eServices Panel. The Working Party will be fully de-briefed by an independent review consultant on their findings and conclusions.

The Working Party has been brought together to review the ongoing purpose and operation of the eServices Panel, including performance and industry and government engagement mechanisms.  This will inform the Assistant Treasurer and Department of Treasury and Finance  of the effectiveness of the current Panel and provide options for improvements for consideration in the design of future eService Panel arrangements.

AIIA is Australia’s peak ICT industry representative body and advocacy group. A not-for-profit organisation that for over 30 years has worked to advocate, promote, represent and grow the ICT industry in Australia. 

Members are organisations (not individuals) ranging from SMEs to listed Australian organisations and multinational corporations. Currently representing over 400 member organisations totalling more than 40,000 employees and almost 20 billion dollars in annual Australian revenue.

Our Vision is of a future where a thriving, sustainable and influential information industry accelerates the digital economy to enhance Australia’s productivity and sustainability.

Based on more than 20 years in the IT, Software and Consulting industry, David has gained skills which are invaluable to companies for which IT is mission-critical.

Kartyer specialises on producing expert reports for prospectuses, board reports and similar activities.

Kartyer assessments are practical and based on real experience in the delivery of IT systems and day-to-day operations.

Facilitated collaboration both Nationally and Internationally within the firm.

jobs.description:
I established Connecting Home Limited as a Start-Up company as its inaugural CEO & Company Secretary

Connecting Home is a lead agency to survivors of the Stolen Generations delivering case management, community education, event management and advocacy. Our service & governance model are somewhat greenfield (in this sector) and blends service provision & corporate governance from Aboriginal and Mainstream services and constructs.

My long history within mainstream community services and management has brought a different approach to Connecting Home, without losing the essence of Community Control, as it is usually applied in Aboriginal services. Connecting Home has also established a case management framework that is unique and we have also created a data collection concept that enables us to report outcomes in a manner that is unique, yet powerful for stakeholders. 

We have established a number of International networks with First Nations people's in order to advance the cause of the Stolen Generations within Australia.

During my time at UCCO, I led a management team that implemented major systemic and organisational change and implemented a new style of case management. UCCO employed over 100 staff members and a multi-million dollar budget.

I was responsible for all of the operations of this very regionally diverse disability and

general.description:
One of the founders of Red Sky, Ernie works with senior executives in building their leadership capabilities, developing strategy and creating an environment where people can perform at their best.

Ernie has a unique ability to engage individuals and teams and get to the core of their leadership challenges. He also has the skill to shape his approach to the needs of the person or group.

Drawing on his experience with a wide range of global clients and a background from the diverse worlds of law, politics and acting, Ernie is able to offer clients insights that stimulate thought and produce creative solutions.

He began his professional life in Washington D.C. where he worked with a foreign policy lobby group and on the campaign staff of a candidate for the United States Senate.

Returning to Australia, Ernie worked for 9 years as a lawyer with firms in Melbourne and Sydney, specializing in international business transactions.  

Before entering the world of communications and leadership development in 2001, Ernie worked as a professional actor appearing in many stage productions and several feature and short films.  As such, he is able to offer clients not only a valuable learning experience, but a memorable one as well.

Ernie is also a much sought after public speaker at conferences and special events where he uses his natural humour and energy to challenge and entertain his audiences.

He enjoys teaching people how to systematically achieve their goals in business and in life, based on tried and proven principles he has first thoroughly researched and implemented. He firmly believes that good business is all about building ongoing and rewarding relationships that are mutually beneficial, where everybody benefits from a WIN-WIN situation. Derick believes some of life’s greatest rewards are gained from the ability to provide quality information and services that have a positive and lasting impact upon other peoples’ lives and their business. He is committed to providing the highest standards of training, materials, service and support possible.

Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) is a discipline that empowers people to utilize the structures of human communication and human excellence, thereby allowing people to think, communicate and manage more effectively. NLP is about developing and improving the relationships between how we think (neuro), how we communicate (linguistic) and our patterns of behavior and emotion (programes). It is a powerful skill used in business management, psychology, sales, sports coaching and all forms of personal development.
Hypnotherapy is a form of psychotherapy utilized to create unconscious change in the patient in the form of new responses, thoughts, attitudes, behaviors and/or feelings.

Currently Derick has over 20 years experience in martial arts including Judo (Brown belt) and Kyokushin Karate (Sandan 3rd Degree Blackbelt). He enjoys teaching students at all levels from the age of 4 to adults. His kyokushin teacher, master and good friend is Shihan Eddie Emin who is respected as one of the top 3 in the world today.He has competed in full contact (No Pads) in State, National and International Championships including Japanese Championships. In 2006 aged 43 years old, Derick won the Victorian United Martial Arts Championships which was open to all different styles and disciplines. He competed against opponents from Muay Thai, Tai Kwon Do, and Karate.He enjoys teaching all levels from children to adults.

general.headline: Keynotes, Huffington Post Columnist, Fatigue Prevention Speaker, Author, Wellness Thoughtleader, Licensed Avatar® Master
general.description:
FATIGUE PREVENTION
Step into the cutting edge of science. There are over 2000 Physical Education Colleges in the world, all researching Human Performance. Many have been doing this research for nearly 100 years. They investigate diet, fitness, training, posture, sleep, psychology, mental wellbeing, sociology, drugs, workloads and a raft of other criteria, all with the intention of having a better understanding of Human Performance.

One area that receives a great deal of research attention is fatigue and recovery. Fatigue is an athlete’s greatest enemy. Learning how to train and play hard, without stepping too far across the fatigue line is a learned skill and crucial to effective self-management.

I bring cutting edge Fatigue Prevention Education to your workforce. My work brings a wealth of science and experience into helping your teams prevent their own fatigue. Plus, we bring the latest in Wellness technology to teach your people how to remain mentally and emotionally well, to stay well ahead of the pressures and stresses of life.

I also deliver:
Workplace Wellness
Powerful Keynotes
Stress Management
Workplace Mental Health Education
Men’s Health
Workplace Health Seminars

THE AVATAR COURSE
If you wish to transcend your thinking mind, find inner peace, calm the business of your mind and perhaps experience enlightenment, ask me about The Avatar Course. This is a powerful 9 day experience, using extraordinary tools that, when aligned with your intention, help you create the experiences your prefer in life whilst leaving behind old habits and patterns, removing limitations and stepping into your true potential. This is a non-religious program that simply provides the tools, support and guidance. The rest is up to you.

jobs.description:
I Head up the Fatigue Prevention Company, a new leader in the quest to empower
      every single worker to know how to, and to choose to, better manage themselves to
      prevent fatigue becoming an issue in their lives. This does not mean a person never
      becomes tired, but tiredness and lethargy will be more likely to occur when the person
      is due to have their normal sleep time, and not when they are in the middle of their
      
      most active wake period.

Delivering Powerful Educational Seminars on Workshops on Fatigue Prevention in the
      Workplace. My aim is not simply to ensure that workers return to their families at the
      completion of a shift, but to ensure they have the energy to engage with their family
      
      and live life now.

schools.description: What a great school Marcellin was and still is. I still keep an involvement with the Old Collegians association. Each year I also attend the school to give talks on Wellness and Mental Health to Years 11 and 12 students.

This was a tough old school. Situated deep in working class inner suburban Melbourne, the school had no playing fields. All we had was a concrete quadrangle, not dissimilar to a prison exercise yard, minus the grass. The school was run by Christian Brothers who were tough, ruthless and uncompromising as they sought to tame 300 boys from the working class. I created many beliefs whilst at this school that took me a lifetime to untangle. But, I also learned how to survive, how to move among groups and how to talk. I learned to survive.

general.description:
Would you benefit from developing your leadership effectivenes? Are you an executive or entrepreneur leading a team, or an emerging leader who is looking for an executive coach in Melbourne to help you get even better results in your career or business? 

We would love the opportunity to contribute to your personal leadership journey and the achievement of your career or business goals, in whatever manner that serves you best.

Our mission is to help successful leaders achieve positive change in behaviour: for themselves, their people and their teams. Kerry Little is an experienced Managing Director who brings a wealth of knowledge and dedication to the role of executive coach. Kerry has a unique combination of skills that makes him an asset to any coaching role. He is a results-oriented coach who helps executives using his reflective and pragmatic style. His deep business understanding allows him to step into a variety of situations and support executives toward guaranteed, measurable progress in leadership behaviour. Kerry is a preferred coaching supplier to leading organisations across Australia. 

At Executive Coaching Melbourne, we define effective leaders as people able to work with and through others to help them achieve their role outcomes, and through that process, the specific objectives of their organisation, and we exist to support leaders developing themselves and their leadership team. Significantly, 90% of learning is 'on the job', which means important people remain productive, while they learn how to be even more productive.

jobs.description:
Established in 1974, Barker Trailers is a family owned business that has been in operation for over 40 years, manufacturing customised truck trailers, supplying products Australia wide into diverse industry sectors, including waste & recycling, food manufacture, logistics and mining. The main factory and head office is at Woodend, with a second production site at Maryborough. Barker Trailers employs around 200 people, with close to 25 apprentices. 

Synonymous with road transport in Australia, Barker Trailers is one of Australasia’s leading manufacturers of: 
1.	Standard road transport equipment to suit interstate long-haul general freight such as:
•	Curtainsider trailers
•	Flat Top trailers
•	Drop Deck trailers and;
•	Skeletals for transporting shipping containers.
2.	Specialist trailers such as:
•	Container tippers for the plastics, chemical and fertilizer industries.
•	B Double and Road Train trailers for efficient long haul freight distribution.
•	Drop Deck trailers for hay carting, often fitted with ramps for machinery transport.
•	Wide trailers for the machinery transport and specialist transporter industries.
•	Extendable trailers (up to 23.5m long) for transporting steel and long indivisible loads.
•	Barker “Sentinel” trailers with load restraint rated side curtains which eliminate the need for operators to handle heavy awkward side gates.
•	Barker “Swissliner” trailers with side doors for rapid and safe loading and unloading of product – also load restraint rated.
•	Trailers designed for the transport of wood chip and domestic refuse from council waste transfer stations.

jobs.jobTitle: Executive Coach | Leadership Development Facilitator | Career Coach
jobs.description:
Executive Coaching Melbourne provides executive and leadership improvement programs that achieve guaranteed and measurable outcomes.

The programs are tailored to individual, team and organisational needs and involve a combination of coaching, counselling and mentoring. Before we do any coaching, we use some of the world’s best psychometric tools to inquire deeply into the natural leadership aptitudes of people, to identify the strengths and weaknesses of each developing leader. Any gaps or blind spots are identified and their strengths recognised, so gaps can be filled and strengths mindfully used to best advantage

Our coaching process is unique. Based on a lifetime of research and learning about successful leadership, it’s  so powerful, it’s been used by over 100 Fortune 500 companies. The Marshal Goldsmith Stakeholder Centered Leadership Development Framework is the arguably the most effective behavioural coaching methodology available today. Developed by Marshal Goldsmith, a man consistently  acknowledged as one of the most influential business and leadership thinkers of our time (recognized as the # 1 leadership thinker in the world and the # 7 business thinker in the world at the bi-annual Thinkers 50 ceremony sponsored by the Harvard Business Review in 2012), his leadership coaching framework places huge emphasis on developing the skills to motivate, inspire and energise others, and applies some of the most powerful management concepts available today, to your leadership style and organisation.

90% of learning is 'on the job', which means important people remain productive, while they learn how to be even more productive.

jobs.jobTitle: Founder and CEO | Next Generation SaaS Platform for Trades Services
jobs.description:
With the rise of social, local, mobile and cloud based platforms, changing consumer demands are putting new pressures on SMBs to deliver an exceptional customer experience or risk losing business to competitors. 

The Trades Services sector in Australia is no different! New disruptive technologies are making way into their business processes, and those who are accepting the change as part of their cultural overhaul, will rise and shine as industry leaders.

Having worked closely with Trades Services business owners for over a decade establishing their digital footprint in the competitive online marketplace, lead me to develop an innovative SaaS platform, i4Tradies, aimed to bridge the gap between Trades Services companies and their customers. 

What makes i4Tradies a truly revolutionary Customer Experience Management solution?

★ Industry specific and customer focus local community experience model.
★ 360-degree job visibility, team collaboration and on-the-field productivity.
★ Deeper consumer data insights, cash flow and workflow management. 
★ Relationship based rather than a one-time transaction based solution.
★ Social community sharing, localised consumer targeting and on-the-go mobile access. 
★ Customer satisfaction through consistent service delivery across all touchpoints.
★ Reduce your cost of technology ownership and scaling the grow of your business 

Currently i4Tradies is in its beta version, ready to roll out only to a few handpicked progressive Trades Services Companies in Australia. 

Our platform is well suited but not limited to the following Trades Services businesses:

Plumbing, Electrical, Air Conditioning, Roofing, Cleaning etc.

Feel free to connect with me today via www.i4Tradies.com.au and we’ll show you how this new innovative Customer Experience Management platform can transform your Trades Services business to match today's consumer expectations and step up your organic growth.

Having demonstrated strategic and operational excellence for a number of start-up businesses, as a member of a couple of businesses, I am open to serving as a Board/Advisory member of progressive companies in Australia and overseas.

I have:
★ 22 years of experience in working for MNC organisations (BHP, Cathay Pacific Airways and SITA) in Europe, Asia and Australia.
★ 15 years of experience as the CEO of a Digital Transformation Solution company  - solomoIT.
★ 3 Years of experience as the Founder of Next Generation SaaS Platform for Trades Services  - i4Tradies - A disruptive cloud-based platform.
★ An intensive network of contacts with credible individuals in the industry including investors, marketers, advisors, entrepreneurs, top management etc.
★ Skills ranging from strategic planning,  team management, leadership, management counseling and business development.  
★ In-depth knowledge of fields including ICT (Global Networks and Digital Transformation Technologies), Finance, Risk Management, HR, Marketing, Business Law

If you think I can serve as a valuable addition to your board, feel free to get in touch with me.

jobs.companyName: Amazon Best Selling Author - The Ultimate Digital Transformation Guide for SMEs
jobs.description:
With over 3 billion of the global population relying on the web for their daily life-style, expert predictions indicate that businesses will drastically change the way they operate with the emergence of Digital Technology, challenging the status quo on a daily basis. “Think Digital – The Ultimate Digital Transformation Guide for Small to Medium Enterprises”, is designed to empower start-ups, SMEs and entrepreneurs with tools and techniques to stay ahead in this aggressive industry by bridging the gap between theoretical advice and practical strategy implementation. 

This book brings together insights gained through extensive research on digital transformation best practices and the author’s decade long experience in digital transformation. This digital transformation guide takes its readers through an enlightening journey unraveling the mysteries of the digital world. The book will teach how to balance all the small parts to work in tandem towards achieving the bigger goals, be it your company culture, investing in employees, processes and technology or using a combination of these to re-shape the ultimate customer experience. Highlighting real-life examples through case-studies from industries as diverse as technology, retail and finance, the book demonstrates how leading companies are using the digital transformation framework to stay cutting-edge and competitive in this age. Explore different topics and perspectives around digital transformation with Logan Nathan and arm your business with strategies that will prepare you for the future.

WHAT I DO:
Cryptocurrencies have just recently been banned from Facebook and Google Adwords. As a result, cryptocurrency companies need to explore other avenues to generate traffic.

My company helps cryptocurrency companies dominate organic search rankings through content marketing and SEO.

I am also the Founder and organizer of the DMSS conference, an annual event hosting over 300+ digital marketing professionals each year. 

HOW I DO IT:
SEO for cryptocurrencies is a wild west right now. The market is so new that no one has a firm grip on rankings. This means that if you start your SEO strategy now, you can dominate SEO and stake your claim in this market. 

WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING:
“Brie is an excellent digital marketing strategist with a broad range of experience. In his time working with us he increased our SEO rankings to the first page for all keywords we were targeting. general.description:
Braham is a Channel Management Expert, Strategic Thinker, Change Agent, and implementer of Innovative Hybrid Sales Models for Global Companies

Braham Shnider began Channel Enablers in 1999 and is its Founder and Global CEO until June 2013. In 2011 Braham helped negotiate to sell Channel Enablers to Miller Heiman Inc. and now acts as an Executive Consultant. He has turned his focus back to the activities that led him to start Channel Enablers, helping customers with their strategic channel decisions, planning, and operational implementations.  

Braham specializes in channel and alliance strategy consulting, operational reviews, GTM planning and development of channels and sales teams. He has facilitated many leadership, strategy and training workshops for global companies.  He is a regular keynote speaker on Channels and Alliances Best Practices and runs channels and alliance management workshops globally.  

Braham has over 25 years of sales and marketing experience with technology companies and has worked in over 30 countries.Clients that he has personally assisted include Cisco, Citrix, EMC, HP, IBM, Lenovo, Oracle, Redhat, SAP, Symantec, VMware and many more large, mid size and small cap companies.

In 1992 Braham founded the distribution business of ITG Computers and within a few years grew this to become the largest distributor in Asia for IBM and Compaq.  In 1999 Braham helped negotiate to sell ITG to Ingram Micro [NYSE: IM].  He remained with Ingram as General Manager, PC and Peripheral Division for six months before leaving to found Channel Enablers.

He resides in Melbourne Australia with his wife and three children

Specialties: channel strategy and training for high tech vendors

jobs.description:
Verdicorp manufactures Organic Rankine Cycle Turbines to convert low grade thermal energy (90-180°C) from sources like: Geothermal, Waste Heat (recovered from commercial and industrial processes), Biomass, Biogas and Solar Thermal into useful electricity that can be sold back to the grid or used to offset the end users existing consumption.

Verdicorp developed oil free, high speed, magnetic bearing turbo expander generators utilising the core technology in the Danfoss Turbocor refrigeration compressor. This gives the Verdicorp Organic Rankine Cycle Turbine many advantages, the key being oil free high speed operation, leading to higher efficiency, greater output.

She was born in Ukraine when it was still part of the USSR and arrived on the shores of Melbourne in 1989. As an avid traveler, Anna has visited 38 countries on 6 continents around the world exploring cultures, meeting new people and snowboarding. In the last decade, she has committed myself to further personal and business development and finally settled into a life of service that she loves.

Since completing her Bachelor of Communications in 2003 she has worked at award-winning marketing agencies, consulted to small business owners and NFPs, run a franchise of Aussie Farmers Direct, founded Revive Success Training and has just launched the Holistic Business Hub, a  beautiful and calming venue for hire where holistic practitioners, business professionals, and soulpreneurs can host their own events, a space where people can teach, learn, collaborate and grow.

Her personal vision is for every person to love the life they live. And her mission is to cause global transformation by inspiring every person to be extraordinary. This may sound idealistic and one may ask; how can a marketing specialist achieve these goals? The answer; helping those that help others.

Diverse in depth experience with global brands including 8 years in chartered with Deloitte and the last 5 years with GE Capital. Worked closely and fostered strong relationships with CFOs and Regional Financial Controllers as well as other C-Level executives and Boards. A role that provides strong technical challenge, stakeholder and people management will be a great next step.

The GFC had an interesting impact on my career back in 2009...experienced my first redundancy, you may have been in this boat yourself before or currently in it - take heart, it will pass!! It actually helped me reassess my priorities and evaluate my dreams, it pushed me into starting my very first business - in real estate. More importantly it also ushered me into a great financial services role, partnering with the business in their financial and regulatory reporting needs. 

Throughout my professional and business career I have enjoyed working with business stakeholders, being at the coal face of decision making be it in a Corporate Board room or at a Cafe with an upstart entrepreneur. 

I am passionate about speaking to people about entrepreneurship and business, I love to see businesses grow and impact community. As a Speaker and Coach I train on the "Dream Maximiza Model"​ and the "13 Pillars of Success" under the label #BusinessGenerals. 

☛ I would love to personally connect with you...speak soon.
✉ dmutabwa@outlook.com.au
✆ +61 405 521 461

jobs.jobTitle: ► Financial Controllership and Regulatory Reporting & Internal Audit
jobs.description:
Reporting to Regional Group Financial Controller as Regulatory Reporting Leader (Oct'10 - Dec'14). Responsible for the production of the monthly financials, management reports and board packages. Ensuring the provision of accurate and timely external financial and regulatory reporting for Australia and NZ entities (to APRA, RBA, ABS, RBNZ and NZSO). Managed accounting operations, accounting close, account reporting and reconciliations. Coordinated stakeholder relationships with APRA, External Auditors and Group Treasury. In charge of staff development and mentoring.

Reporting to the Asia-Pac Head of Audit as Strategy & Operations Manager for Internal Audit (Jan'14-Feb'16). Responsible for the development of the future internal audit strategy of the organisation reporting to the local board and International HQ. Responsible for the month end close process including preparation of all internal audit month end and year end board/executive reports/analysis. Responsibility for managing internal audits and the management of all engagement outcomes including overseeing the audit teams in planning, fieldwork and reporting. In charge of strategic and operational activities of the function including training and capability assessments, developing the annual training plan reporting to US HQ learning and development team.

The GFC had a defining impact on my career back in 2009, I experienced my first redundancy. This forced me reassess my priorities and evaluate my dreams. It pushed me into starting Lodging & Living Australia, my very first business, awesome experience.

Founded and operated Lodging and Living Australia, a real estate company specialising in providing furnished shared accommodation in different locations within the inner Eastern suburbs of Melbourne. 

This business has provided me with enormous experience in the strategic and operational management of the business, including:
•	Marketing and sales
•	On-boarding and off-boarding of tenants
•	Client engagement and customer service
•	Dispute resolution
•	Regulatory compliance
•	Administration and accounting for the operations

I now use my learnings from this business to train other people on how they can create an additional income stream through this unique property strategy of rooming houses as a part time or full time income.

Responsible for all technical accounting and statutory reporting requirements including taking staff training accounting and reporting. Took charge of the full corporate head office finance function at Farm Pride including full year and half year statutory reporting as well as being first contact for external auditors.  

Monthly management accounts including full reconciliations of all balances including input into the monthly variance analysis board report. Treasury - Bank liaison including covenant and forecast reporting, facilities renegotiation and assessment of all new finance requirements of the Group.

GST compliance including reconciliation and lodging of the monthly BAS returns for the Consolidated Group including being in charge of a team of 6 direct reports. Responsible for fixed assets, accounts payable, accounts receivable and payroll together with weekly KPI reporting for the Group.

Preparation of technical position papers for executives and board as well as for auditors throughout the year. Contribution to the Group regarding the improved audit process at both half year and full year, streamlining reporting turnaround time and reducing time to market release. Completed a corporate governance review and implemented key changes and improvements for the Group.

Successfully managed an audit portfolio of over 30 clients reporting directly to the Engagement Partners, managing teams of up to seven staff.

Key client industry sector: Superannuation funds, Manufacturing, Retail, Healthcare, Professional Services, Not for profit and Mining. 

Training of staff during the year including formal training for new graduates and audit seniors in the educational sector audits and involved in new accounting standards roll out training and facilitation.

Transferred to Melbourne on an international secondment and became permanent member of staff in August 2006.

Managed successful recurrent audits for corporate medium sized clients mainly in the retail sector, government aided schools, not for profits, legal firms, pension fund audits and insolvencies. 

This encompassed the performance of the job from the planning, to the field work right through to finalisation, signing of accounts and the post finalisation house keeping duties such as credit control, staff appraisal, overall maintenance of the jobs in progress report and the staff yearly planner.

general.headline: Online Revenue Growth Director at RedPepper Mergers
general.description:
WHAT I CAN DO FOR YOU:

To optimize your eCommerce business growth I can review and tweak your website to get more conversion (sales), so you can increase your revenue and grow faster.


WHY IT MATTERS TO YOU:

Even slightly increasing your conversion rate can have a massive impact on your bottom line. For instance, if you have 10,000 monthly visitors and 1% conversion, then you’ve made 100 sales. Increasing conversion to 1.5% could mean another 50 sales. How much extra profit would that be for your business?


HOW I WILL INCREASE YOUR CONVERSION:

I will approach your site like a doctor. First, I will examine your website to make a diagnosis and recommendations. Then I will have my tech team make the changes you accept, so you can be free to focus on other areas of your business.


WHY IT WILL WORK FOR YOU:

My method is very thorough and only focuses on conversion. After I have a look at your site (considering design, coding, and sales flow), I will ask you to fill out an extensive business and marketing survey. Then I will implement my recommendations, solving the most urgent issues first, thereby ensuring you the fastest and highest possible return on your investment.


WHO I HAVE WORKED WITH BEFORE

Here are some of the companies I have worked with:

- Easyweddings.com.au
- Belowthepin.com.au
- Bulletpoint.com.au
- Buenosairescitypass.com 
- Melanietoniaevans.com
- Conversiongym.co
- Swingmangolf.com
- Cambridgeimmerse.com
- Hearingcentral.com

WHAT MAKES ME DIFFERENT?

Unlike most conversion optimization specialists, I focus not only on increasing conversion rates, but also on emphasizing the business behind your website. I know your website is not telling the entire story, and you might have valuable information to add to the site - which you might not even be aware of!

I also have extensive experience presenting at Uber, General Assembly, Academy Xi and the Entrepreneurship Social Club.

jobs.description:

jobs.jobTitle: Conversion Optimization Strategist | Business Analyst | Growth Hacker
jobs.description:
WHAT I CAN DO FOR YOU:

I can review and tweak your website to get more conversion so you can scale up faster and increase your revenue.


WHY IT MATTERS:

Even slightly increasing your conversion rate can have a massive impact on your bottom line. For instance, if you have 10,000 monthly visitors and 1% conversion, then you’ve made 100 sales. Increasing conversion to 1.5% could mean another 50 sales. How much extra profit would that be for your business?


HOW I DO IT:

I approach my job like a doctor. I examine your website to make a diagnosis, provide you with a preliminary recommendation, and then precisely implement my recommendation, leaving you free to focus on other areas of your business.


WHY IT WORKS:

My method is very thorough and only focuses on conversion. After I have a look at your site (considering design, coding, and sales flow), I will ask you to fill out an extensive business and marketing survey. Then I will implement my recommendations, solving the most urgent issues first, thereby ensuring you the fastest and highest possible return on your investment.


HOW TO GET STARTED:

Just message me here on LinkedIn and share with me your URL. Then we can maybe have a discussion on Skype were we go over your site page-by-page?

I regularly teach digital subjects like conversion optimization, google analytics, google
      adwords and growth hacking. Through General Assembly I have also taught at events
      
      held by Uber, Future Assembly and City of Melbourne.

WHAT AM I DOING:

I am responsible to set and drive digital strategy to maximise company growth. Practically it means I work with creating and tweaking online sales funnels while driving traffic to them. A lot of my time is spent listening to what the sales team need and working with the techs and designers to solve that need. 

WHAT HAVE I DONE:

- Increased lead conversion rate by 300%
- Reduced cost per paid lead by nearly 80%
- Created a scaleable lead generation funnel

My main KPI is to drive signups to goLance by improving the user experience and build
      a community by creating and sharing engaging content to assist clients and
      freelancers. The end goal is to be the leading marketplace for freelancers and clients to
      
      work together.

I worked with tweaking and optimising sales funnels. That includeed reviewing analytics, creating wireframes, writing copy, A/B testing, assisting with pricing strategy, branding and product development. I was fortunate to work in a start-up which gave me a lot of variety to learn new things, and freedom in finding my own way of doing it.

WHAT I DID:

I worked to build a global community of freelancers who interested in growing their skills and getting more business. Pursuant to this work, I wrote 4 books and created an interactive course for freelancers on how to make money on marketplaces like Elance, oDesk, Guru, and Freelancer.

WHY IT MATTERS:

Unlike most other professionals, freelancers have very few gathering places––as far as I know, there is no platform that focuses exclusively on the businesses that are developing for them. Attracting a higher standard of clients requires improving the professional standard of freelancers, so just such a marketplace has growth potential for everyone involved.

HOW I DID IT:

My job was a combination of growth hacking, project management, coaching, and writing. Freelancers came to me asking for advice; business owners and recruiters came to me asking if I know someone. Most of the time, I just tried to be helpful.

WHY IT WORKED

Many of the students I helped now make good money as freelancers. They tell me that my material is broken down well into simple, manageable steps. I also wrote based on my own personal experience as both a client and a freelancer. That made it possible for me to write material that is directly applicable and useful.

Make Tasty Wine is a web-based company which provides guidance on making wine in your own home. The site is supported by an award-winning winemaker in Napa.

Key Achievements

- Successfully negotiated agreement with an award-winning winemaker from Napa to provide her support. 
- Created and implemented social media strategy which achieved 25% sharing in its first few days. 
- Created and implemented Twitter strategy with 10-20 new targeted followers added every day.

- Made several mini-books for promotion. (Two of them can be accessed below.)

Key Achievements:

- Endorsement from a former divorce judge and divorce lawyer praising the book as a good tool for reducing the cost of divorce. 
- Published a series of mini-books. (Can be accessed below.)

general.headline: Strategic Sourcing Support Analyst at National Australia Bank
general.description:
I am an enthusiastic and motivated professional with a particular interest in Analytics and data science. 

I have recently completed a Masters of Commerce, whereby I attained a 70+ average. Additionally, I also received an award from Deakin University for being the 'Best Graduating Student'​ with an information systems specialisation. My dedication to my studies, as well as other relevant work experience, has encouraged me to pursue a career within the field of superannuation. 

In my current employment at Super Partners, I primarily engage in customer service. I am entrusted with a variety of tasks, such as administrative duties and data entry. Such roles have enabled me to sharpen my communication and organsational skills, which I had developped from an earlier stage of my life. Predating my employment at Super Partners, I also worked within a number of different customer service environments. This includes my employment at Saipon Thai Cafe, as well as Skilled Group. 

Furthermore, I have been an active volunteer at Oakleigh Centre for over five continuous years. My dedication to such a group displays my passion for giving back to the community and to those in need. My time at the Oakleigh Centre helped me to develop key multitasking and empathy skills, which I believe are important qualities. By working with disabled individuals, I have once again been able to develop my interaction skills and on a further level, I have been able to develop a greater patience and understanding for those who are in need. My dedication to the community was acknowledged in a 'Recognition of Service' award, which I take great pride in. 

In my spare time, I like to develop my skill set by engaging in further extra curricular studies. My desire to constantly learn new things can be demonstrated through the extended courses I partake in on Coursera and Udemy. Primarily, my focus centers around Analytics and data science.

general.headline: PERSONAL BRANDING Consultant| Teaching COACHES & CONSULTANTS How To Create Powerful Personal Brands & Online Courses | Teach CORPORATE PROFESSIONALS How To Future Proof Their Career Through Personal Branding
general.company: Mary Henderson Coaching & Founder of  6 Figure Expert
general.description:
WHAT I DO: I help Coaches, Consultants & Corporate Professionals unpack & enhance their Personal Brand to stand out, become an authority in the marketplace and win new business.

WHY IT MATTERS:  In today’s digital economy, your Personal Brand is the ONE thing nobody else can BE or replicate, especially if you’re a Business Coach, Consultant or Solo Business Owner.  People are buying YOU (i.e. Personal Brand) as much as the products or services your provide.

WHAT MAKES ME UNIQUE: You can take the girl out of tech, but you can’t take the tech out of the girl!  I grew up professionally in the IT industry and tech and algorithms are in my blood.  As a result, I’ve developed a unique, proprietary algorithm around Personal Branding that helps you get clear on - what you do (your uniqueness) , who you serve (your target audience), what you stand for (your mission), what you promise (your authority).

MY STORY: Having spent the past 13 years both creating and running my own digital agency, along with working as a Coach & Consultant for clients such as Open Universities, UNSW, Start Up Entrepreneurs & Coaches, I have a unique perspective & passion for the importance of Personal Branding in today’s marketplace.  

WHAT OTHERS SAY:
“Among the many success coaches and Internet marketing consultants, I think the main reason Mary is so successful, and a joy to work with, is that she most sincerely cares about contributing more than she receives. She is the best of the best, and it has been an honor and blessing to witness her in action.”
Dr Leonard Horowitz, International Health Activist, Researcher, Educator, Author & Filmmaker.

HOW IT WORKS: I have an online coaching program,  1:1 coaching, group workshops, consulting.

READY TO TALK? Reach out to me directly here on LinkedIn, 
E: mary@maryhendersoncoaching.com
W: https://www.maryhendersoncoaching.com/ or 
1:1 Coaching: Book a 60 minute coaching call here: 
https://www.maryhendersoncoaching.com/60_minute_coaching_session/

schools.degree: Compliance and enforcement of Work, Health and Safety (WHS) legislation
schools.description: This course aims to improve the awareness of Officers as to their ‘Due Diligence’ duty in their workplace under the Work Health and Safety Act. Work health and safety is in everyone's interest. As a worker, you have a duty to ensure your behaviour at work does not endanger you or anyone else. In this interactive course, you will work through real Australian work health and safety scenarios and activities based on Australian work settings to cement your understanding of your work health and safety rights and responsibilities.

Bullying can be devastating to both the person who is bullied and the workplace culture in which bullying behaviour occurs. You can help combat workplace bullying by knowing how to identify, respond to and report workplace bullying. This self-paced and interactive Australian course uses real case studies to highlight what bullying is, the damage bullying can cause and how the law protects victims.

schools.degree: Workplace Discrimination and Harassment - Legal Compliance
schools.description: You have a right to a work environment that is free from discrimination, harassment and sexual harassment. To achieve this, everyone at work has legal responsibilities to ensure their interaction with others is appropriate. In this self-paced interactive course, you will work through real Australian case studies to learn more about how workplace discrimination and harassment laws and policies apply in your workplace.

general.headline: Director and Founder, Buzz Products

jobs.description:
Buzz is a global creative agency that solves marketing and business challenges through product design solutions. 

Based in Melbourne, with offices in Shanghai and Hong Kong, Buzz comprises a 70+ team of passionate designers, production experts and client service, marketing and finance professionals.

A full-service agency, Buzz manages the entire product development process encompassing ideation, design, prototyping, manufacturing, testing and logistics. Offering innovative product solutions Buzz’s design capabilities span across Airline, FMCG, Health & Beauty, QSR and Retail industries.

Buzz created products can be found in the air on major airlines from every continent including; Qantas, Delta and Qatar to name a few. Buzz designs and develops luxury in-flight amenities that feature premium designer collaborations, and brings to life fun children’s kits that incorporate popular licenses that kids adore! Innovative product categories soon to take-off include; textiles, entertainment and in-flight connected items and tech accessories. 

On the ground, Buzz is creating unique, impactful products in the FMCG realm, from customised vending machines and foosball tables to cutting-edge connected products with a twist! Buzz Health & Beauty and Retail are working with major brands and retailers to deliver premium on-the-shelf product and clever packaging solutions.

In the past 12 months, Buzz has been recognised in the Top 10 of BRW’s Most Innovative Companies List and was named TravelPlus Most Innovative Supplier of 2011.

www.buzzproducts.com

Room Interior Products began as an Australian product design company in 1994. Rooms export quickly outgrew its local sales. As a result in 1999 Room opened a logistics and distributions office in Hong Kong. This quickly lead to distribution arms in many countries with its design products found in most good department, homeware and gift stores world wide.

allSkills: Brand Development, Product Design, Marketing Strategy, Packaging, Sales, Retail, Concept Development, Graphic Design, FMCG, Industrial Design, Manufacturing, Creative Direction

general.headline: Co-Founder & CEO at Simple Foods
general.description:
Sam is a business leader with over 15 years of experience in the Consumer Goods, Financial and IT Advisory Services industries. His career has evolved from major professional services firms, where he led projects and advised blue-chip clients in the retail, mining, government and IT sectors; to being the Managing Director of a highly successful family-owned national consumer goods business. 

Sam’s career thus far has been characterised by adaptability, innovation and teamwork. As a finalist in the prestigious AFR Boss Magazine and the CEO Magazine Young Executive of the Year awards, he is recognised as a person who relishes the opportunities that arise in times of change, and who can bring others into a shared vision.

jobs.description:
The humble Aussie pantry is undergoing a transformation. With it, has come a demand
      for food that is both healthful and accessible.
      

    
      

    Enter Simple Foods, a nutrition-led, natural and organic food business. Changing the
      
      way Australian's eat, for the better.

SecondBite exists to provide access to fresh, nutritious food for people in need across Australia. SecondBite do this by rescuing and redistributing surplus fresh food, building community capacity in food skills and nutrition, and advocating for an end to food insecurity.

In 2015-16, SecondBite redistributed 10 million kilograms of fresh, healthy produce free of charge to more than 1,200 community food programs. This equates to 20 million meals.

jobs.jobTitle: Advisor to the Board and Management
jobs.description:
The Monde Nissin group has been operating in South-East Asia for over 30 years. The group is a leading manufacturer, marketer and distributor of food products including instant noodles, biscuits and other snack foods. Monde Nissin owns Menora Foods, Black Swan Foods and Nudie Foods in Australia.

Sam’s role with Monde Nissin was focused on the transition of the Menora business into the Monde Nissin group and advising the Board and Management on strategic projects in Australia and international markets.

Established in 1967, Menora Foods is a national leader in consumer goods across Australia and international markets. It is a marketer and distributor of some of Australia’s most trusted brands including Bonne Maman, Maille, Chobani, Cobram Estate and Philips Lighting. It also developed and owns the highly successful brands Wattle Valley and Peckish and previously owned and marketed manufacturing companies including Jindi Cheese, Tasmanian Pate and Interhampers Australia.

Sam had strategic, P&L, sales, marketing and operational responsibility for Menora covering Chilled, Grocery, Bakery, Confectionery and General Merchandise Categories across Australia and international markets. 

Sam’s time at Menora coincided with significant change for the Australian grocery industry with stronger competition and major shifts in customers’ shopping behaviour. Under Sam’s leadership, Menora responded by developing an innovative business model and investing in the people, brands and infrastructure that led Menora to unprecedented levels of growth. These achievements were recognised in the 2014 Independent Pulse Chilled/ Frozen Supplier Satisfaction Survey where Menora was ranked in the top three suppliers in Australia.

In July 2014, Menora initiated a company-wide strategic review following from unsolicited approaches from third parties seeking to purchase the business. This resulted in Menora being acquired by Monde Nissin, one of the leading branded food manufacturers in the ASEAN region.

KPMG is among the world’s foremost professional services networks, employing over 152,000 people in member firms in 156 countries.

At KPMG, Sam led projects and provided strategic, regulatory and financial advice to many blue-chip clients that were among Australia’s leading companies across the retail, mining, government and IT sectors.
