Cadet: Tax, Legal and Business Advisory Services

general.headline: Digital Marketing. Mentor and Creative powerhouse (Too much? Yeah, but you're still reading, so maybe it worked).
general.description:
In short (and forgive the lack of modesty, but if I can’t blow my own horn now, when can I?), I’ve been across most every aspect of marketing.

Having cut my teeth in the fundamentals of digital communications & campaign coordination which involved learning the ins and outs of various CMS and CRM systems for eDM production, I’ve dabbled in a little HTML and CSS, and all things that go into and come out of acquisition and retention campaigns.

Over some 10+ years, my skills have grown hand-in-hand with my experiences. Those experiences have seen me involved either as a lead or foot-soldier in everything from creating and implementing marketing strategies, farming for analytics, driving social media, producing creative content, SEO-rich copy (including proofing and editing), even user acceptance and regression testing. I think you get the idea.

Having said all that, the two greatest assets I bring to any team or project are my ability to humanise the digital experience which allows people to understand the value in what we’re doing, and my almost unbelievable ability to empathise, connect and engage with nearly anyone (again, please forgive the lack of humility. I’m usually quite shy). I’m sure you’ll agree that this can be a powerful tool in marketing. I recently completed some emotional intelligence testing which articulated that my capacity to understand and bond with others knows no bounds. That, coupled with my near inexhaustible energy and boundlessly creative mind enables me to not only produce and push out first-rate projects, but perhaps more importantly I can draw people into the narrative. Wow – that’s perhaps the most ‘marketing’ thing I’ve ever written. It’s exhaustive being me sometimes. Actually, that’s not true. I again refer to the Mariana Trench depths of vigour I draw upon. 

I also enjoy walks on the beach and reading poetry by the fire. As I look back over this, I can see that it actually isn’t as short as I intended it to be. Sorry about that.

jobs.description:
Since joining Post, I've been privileged to work with a team of some of the greatest eDM specialists and data analysts of my career. We've delivered scores of beautifully produced campaigns to the largest email audience in the country. 

On a personal level, I've also busied myself with the UCan2 program, helping two young refugees find employment and begin to build their lives here in Australia.
Through the 'ProjectMe' program, I've also mentored a wonderful group of ladies within the business, sharing my own journey in the hope of inspiring them to grow and develop, both personally and professionally.
Always keen to help not-for-profits out on a pro bono basis. It's good to do good.

TipRanks is a comprehensive investing tool that allows private investors and day traders to see the measured performance of anyone who provides financial advice.  TipRanks provides subscription based services to a range of investors globally, and also provides tailored services to some of the largest online global brokerage firms. 

Established in 2013, TipRanks is a data driven financial accountability tool, allowing investors from all over the spectrum to evaluate any investment advice, perform equity research or generate investment ideas based on what top performing analysts say.

Our Financial accountability engine tracks, analyzes and measures the calls of any Wall Street Analyst or financial blogger using Machine learning and Natural Language Processing (NLP).

TipRanks was awarded as Best Of Show at Finovate Spring 2013 and Finovate Fall 2013 for democratizing the financial web and holding any "financial expert" accountable for their advice.

OurCrowd is a leading equity crowdfunding platform for investors from around the world to invest in global startups. Managed by a team of seasoned investment professionals and led by serial entrepreneur Jon Medved, OurCrowd vets and selects opportunities, invests its own capital, and brings companies to its accredited membership of global investors. OurCrowd provides post-investment support to its portfolio companies, assigning industry experts as mentors and frequently takes board seats. OurCrowd has raised US$250M for its nearly 100 portfolio companies, generating eight exits in three years. The OurCrowd community of 14,000+ investors from over 110 countries, mentors and partners is comprised of a diverse makeup of backgrounds, professions, locations, and investing experience

In early 2014, OurCrowd established its inaugural Branch offices outside Israel in Melbourne and Sydney. Headed by a proven team with a strong start-up pedigree, the Australian Branch provides Fast funding for companies that meet our investment criteria and provides a network of local and overseas mentors to help entrepreneurs achieve their objectives.

Moula is a non-traditional Lender to small business. Within the next 5 years the majority of unsecured small business loans of under $250,000 will be made by 'fin-tech disruptors'.  Moula was the first disruptor of its kind in Australia, providing small businesses with access to funding by using multiple data sources and a proprietary engine to rapidly assess creditworthiness.

Bio-Nexus has developed a Mobile workflow processing software platform which facilitates rapid workflow processing, in environments such as military medical units , hospital emergency rooms, first responders scenario; anywhere where efficient workflow processing can make a difference (e.g. processing of casualties by medics on a battlefield). It could be defined as an end-to-end digital medical platform relevant to the telehealth sector and the creation of a full EMR.

The company has integrated the complex yet flexible software with a heads-up display and a headset, coupled to a portable wireless computer / smartphone or similar device that communicates with a central unit. The system uses speech recognition (hands free capabilities) and interactive menus on the display to facilitate adherence to the protocol and rapid documentation.

Bio-Nexus opened its doors in October 2010 as a software company with the mission of designing a “Mobile Workflow Engine” - the E.L.A.D. System - to securely transfer mission-critical data in a mobile environment.

The initial focus of the E.L.A.D. System is on military use- currently as a mobile tactical-medical platform with the civilian medical sector soon to follow.

The product is now being deployed in Military, Airline, Allied Health and Industry solutions on 3 continents.

Co-working Space.  Gathering like-minds at the former SEEK offices on St Kilda Junction, deskworx offers innovators a flexible, highly professional workspace at the gateway to Melbourne’s biggest corporate boulevard, St Kilda Road, and walking distance from cosmopolitan Fitzroy Street and St Kilda Beach.

Mixing creativity with corporate savvy and loads of light-drenched space, deskworx is the kind of work environment that inspires and shapes to your individual business personality. Our co-working enables expansion and retraction as your business evolves, while keeping operational costs at a minimum; not to mention the vibrancy and networking that only a co-working space provides.

Global Reviews helps large organisations drive growth by focusing on best-practice customer experience.

It objectively benchmarks customer experience performance against competitors and best practice, delivering actionable and prioritised recommendations. The benefits include increased acquisition rates, better customer retention, cross-sell growth ("share of wallet"), and reduced servicing costs.

Global Reviews benchmarks the customer experience across multiple channels including web, email, contact centre, and branches. With offices in Melbourne and London, GR has expertise in around 30 different industries. Clients include banks, telcos, airlines, insurers, energy companies, and universities.

general.headline: Violinist and Entertainer
general.description:
Already a respected and sought-after career musician, Sally Cooper is a shining star in her own right.

For as long as she can remember, violin has always been part of this Melbournian's life. Named a child prodigy, the instrument saw her develop from the concert hall stage, to performing solo concertos with orchestra, then to national television and concert arenas. A stream of successful solo work has kept Sally busy, along with events and tours with some of rock and pop's biggest acts including Bruce Springsteen, Lionel Richie, Rod Stewart, Michael Buble, Harry Connick Jnr, Westlife, Delta Goodrem, Guy Sebastian, Kate Ceberano and Ronan Keating, to name a few.

With her innate gift to play and her natural ability to perform, Sally was accepted into the Conservatorium of Music in her hometown of Adelaide at just eight years of age and was competing in national and international competitions and performing university-level concertos as a soloist with all major Australian orchestras from the age of nine.

In recent years, Sally is a much sought after musician, working in television, performing, recording and leading the string sections on Dancing With The Stars, X Factor Australia, Australia's Got Talent and The Footy Show. She wows the crowds throughout Australia and Asia at private events and in the corporate scene with her exciting solo performances on her electric violin, and is the lead performer in the electric string trio ELEKTRA, best known for entertaining at corporate and sporting events.

Recently, Sally released a classical/pop album called GOLDEN and is currently, excitedly working on her second album, which has more of a soulful house, dance music vibe.

Sally has added her sparkle to countless beautiful events, and she was recently personally booked by Beyoncé to perform at Jay Z's private birthday party. Performing and playing the violin is her passion and her happiness!

Liven is an incentive-based mobile payments gateway and ecosystem purpose built for the lifestyle and dining industries. Hundreds of thousands of people use Liven to discover thousands of restaurants, process millions in instant mobile payments, and earn LVN - The Digital Currency for Food. LVN can be saved up in the platform’s native wallet, spent at any Liven merchant, or donated to a nonprofit organisation directly through the system. Powered by blockchain technology, LVN is a business-backed dynamic network utility token, algorithmically managed by the Liven reward protocol, and made universally accessible via the LivenPay API.

Liven is building the world’s first consumer-centric blockchain platform, bringing the benefits of distributed technology to real people and real businesses.

Learn more about the LivenPay project via livenpay.io

Designed for the $1 trillion global legal industry, the Legaler blockchain and developer tools provide the infrastructure to easily build secure and scalable decentralised applications for legal services without the need for intermediaries.

Proving the technology's power is Legaler Aid, a first-of-its-kind platform that matches disadvantaged clients with pro bono legal advice, fuelled by a tokenised incentive system and a platform for transparent crowdfunding for social justice cases through tax-deductible donations.

Legaler entered the market in April 2017 by launching a secure online meeting tool for the legal industry that is now used by over 1000 firms across 80 countries. With end-to-end encryption for video calls inside your browser, messaging, file sharing and screen sharing, Legaler lets you schedule, host and archive your meetings all in one place: http://legaler.com/

general.headline: Left the corporate world to concentrate on what motivates me most, Mental Health and ridding the world of stigmas.
general.description:
I've left the corporate, property and finance world to embark on other things I'm passionate about, such as Mental Health, Depression, Anxiety and Human Rights issues. 

I believe in preaching what you know and Mental Health including depression, anxiety, suicide, addiction, child abuse and neglect, self-harm to name just a few of my lived experiences. 

I’m midway through a Masters of Counseling and can't wait to begin the next part of my life where I truly believe I can make a difference to those suffering using my life experiences and soon to come education 

Let's rid our society of the Stigma associated with mental health, talking about is what's needed and talk about it I will. 
I’m happy to catch up, but please, no corporate shit unless it involves Mental Health.

general.headline: 2x Founder & Director
general.description:
A forward-thinking entrepreneur with extensive experience in cosmetology and product
      innovation. My mission will always be to empower others, provide strategic solutions and
      
      pave the way for a much needed change in the cosmetics industry.

jobs.description:
Pressplay Cosmetics is an Australian based cosmetics company that has set out to revolutionise the industry. To keep up with our modern lifestyles, we aim to create a way for skincare, makeup and fragrance to work for the wearer, not the other way around. Our patent pending, Pressplay Capsule is a smartphone-sized unit that contains a customisable suite of skin care and cosmetics to keep you on the go and looking your best. Whether you're an avid traveller, an active parent or a fast-paced professional. Don't put your life on pause, press play on your day. 

The concept behind Pressplay Cosmetics arose from my own personal experience as a busy mother and business owner. In the midst of the daily juggle between these roles, my beauty routine took a back seat. I struggled to find high quality makeup products that I could easily take with me to apply in-between meetings, in the car and so on. I knew that in a busy world, I am not the only person with this issue. I took it upon myself to provide a solution. After years of research and with the support of my family and friends, I developed The Pressplay Capsule.

From humble beginnings, Smart Skin Clinics has now grown to four locations and plans for expansion continues. Smart Skin Clinics is more than just your average laser and skin treatment clinic. We go above and beyond and are dedicated to providing our clients with a wide range of high-quality and safe cosmetic procedures using the latest equipment and technology that deliver results to make our clients feel rejuvenated, fresh and confident. 

Our advanced cosmetic skin treatments and procedures are gentle yet provide fast visual results. Furthermore, together with our safe and reliable services, our professionally trained and qualified therapists and our professional clinic setup contribute to a comfortable and pleasant experience.

Our trained and qualified team assist clients with a variety of services, using the most current approach with our skin treatments that achieve exceptional results. We offer the most effective laser, skin, and cosmetic treatments available, specialising in Medical Grade Laser Hair Removal, Cosmetic Tattoo, Skin Care, Teeth Whitening and more.

At People HR we help small to medium enterprises (particularly during the important and sometimes daunting transition growth phase) focus on their core business, while we focus on their people and HR processes. We ensure our clients are legislatively compliant as well as representing the business in the best light. 

To current employees, future employees and the marketplace in general. 

With the war for talent a prevalent catch phrase over the last 10 years, ensuring you are an employer of choice, with a strong employee value proposition (EVP) is imperative to growing a successful business. Effective HR processes maximise staff retention, foster employment relations and create open communication between management and employees. 

Perhaps just as importantly we ensure your business is compliant and risk is mitigated when it comes to employee relations legislation. Not following employee relations law can bring about costly and debilitating outcomes for employers. These can be avoided just by reviewing current processes and ensuring compliance is achieved over time.
 
People HR offers flexible options to choose from whether you outsource all or part of your HR functions.  Whichever option you choose, be assured that you will be able to dedicate more time and focus to your core business.  We can work on specific identified projects, provide on-call as-required advice and provide you with a regular ongoing HR support service without the overheads involved in hiring an in-house team.

We aim to provide you with the support to give your business the best possible chance at unparalleled success.

MG Sourcing provides recruitment and sourcing solutions to clients across several sectors. Our recruitment methodology is based on engagement with the people around us. We do what's required to engage with people in a meaningful way to ascertain what they are looking for in their career. Then we help them find it. We source the best talent in the market and bring them to our clients ready to say yes to their next career opportunity.

MG Sourcing HR also provides a HR support partnership for businesses who are in growth phase. Whether your looking at setting up new HR/employee processes, reviewing your current systems or undertaking an entire change management process to set up for your next phase...we have you covered.

general.headline: Principal Consultant at DXC Technology
general.description:
With over 20 years of experience, Nathan began his IT career in systems administration and network design, and later furthered his knowledge of IT processes, governance, and management to complement his technical skills. As a result, Nathan has a robust degree of knowledge and experience of both the technical and managerial aspects of:

 	+ Infrastructure and operations management;
 	+ Process and governance implementation;
 	+ Financial and commercial management;
 	+ Strategy development and execution;
 	+ Organisational change.

During the past 15 years Nathan’s roles have included Operations Management, Service Delivery Management, Change Management, Commercial Management, Project Management, and the management of specific functional process areas. In these roles, he has been involved in the organisational transformation of IT resources, devising strategies, developing IT Service Management practices, and implementing toolsets, resulting in the enhancement of IT service effectiveness in order to meet business objectives.

Most recently, Nathan led a transformation of the geographically diverse and disparately managed IT function of a global professional services business into one centrally managed, service focussed operations group. This involved the development of a new operations methodology and processes derived from the ITIL V3 Service Management framework, and the establishment of specific competency centres for infrastructure and systems administration, desktop support, application support, and a centralised service desk, supported by knowledge management and service improvement processes.

Specialties: 
IT Service Optimisation,
IT Cost Optimisation,
Infrastructure and Operations management,
Vendor management & Contract negotiation,
IT financial management,
ITIL process design & implementation,
Process maturity assessment & improvement,
Expert in IT Incident, Change, Release, and Configuration Management.

MailGuard | 17 Years | Global Presence | Cloud Experts | 100% CSAT |24 hour, 7 day Phone Support

MailGuard is more than just a leader in spam and virus filtering in the cloud. We provide a full, collaborative suite of business security products, but more than that, we provide peace of mind to businesses around the globe.

Following a career encompassing roles with several technology organizations, including Salmat and Hewlett Packard, I joined MailGuard. I have held several leadership roles with MailGuard, and currently am the Service Delivery Director.

I specialise in Service Delivery, customer/partner care & cloud computing, I provide business and IT leadership, cloud services guidance and channel management expertise.

Currently I work across the entire business, engaging cross-functional teams to ensure customer and partner expectations are not only met, but exceeded. 

As Service Delivery Director, I am proud to promote client and partner service that is far beyond what is expected. We provide 100% uptime for our clients, boast a 100% customer satisfaction, 24/7 phone support from experts working within our business. Our clients are happy because we provide their business with a set and forget service that allows them to get on with business without the worry of spam, malware, downtime, or lost emails. Our partners love us because we provide a service with a high retention rate of clients, ongoing profitability and collaborative marketing to help increase their bottom line. 

More and more, clients and partners are turning to MailGuard for assistance in improving their business through our robust security services and support, and the service delivery team and I look forward to welcoming many, many more onto our services in the future.

If you’re seeking guidance about Cloud Security Services or would like to explore a partnership with MailGuard, let’s connect! Feel free to contact me - anwar@mailguard.com.au.

SEO Freelancer & SEO Consultant in Melbourne | Internet Marketing Expert | Web Developer | WordPress Consultant

I’m a well-rounded Digital Media expert who is passionate about web technologies and the search industry. I have over 7 years’ experience in web development and search engine optimisation (SEO) and worked on over 4000 clients.

My key strengths lie within my ability to rank keywords on Page 1 of Google to drive targeted traffic in variety of industries/niches and to meet aggressive deadlines. 

I’m able to work in an online environment of constant change, challenge and multiple targets. I have extensive experience of content strategy, editorial flow, paid Search advertising, SEO and copywriting. I work closely with a diverse team of copy writers and account managers to achieve the company’s goals and ensure client satisfaction.

I am also a speaker at York Butter Factory’s lunch time information sessions and developer of Chrome addon - SEO Wizard.

I’m originally from India. I migrated to Australia in 2005. I completed a Master’s degree in Computer Science from RMIT. After graduating I then went on to work as a PHP Developer for 5 years before switching my career path to SEO.

•	Search engine optimisation (SEO)

jobs.description:

I frequently research and write articles in a conversational, engaging style. Each blog entry offer best practices information, creates a sense of community and offers educational information, for reader comments. 

I measure and track the effectiveness of blog topics based on number of viewers and number of comments and perform continuous enhancements and modifications to the blog.

As appropriate, I respond promptly to blog comments and e-mail and base my articles around popular requests.

general.headline: Mission Critical HVAC Engineer
general.description:
Huey Liew is a mission critical engineer by professional. He specialises high performance HVAC designs.

In 2011 Huey conceptualised and designed the HVAC plant for University of Adelaide Hub Central that has a design cooling energy efficiency ratio (EER) of 10. The project was commended for Innovation / Research and Development, South Australia Engineering Excellence Award, Engineers Australia in 2012.

Six years after commissioning, the cooling cooling plant is still operating at an unprecedented energy efficiency ratio of more than 10, three to four times better than a comparable chilled water systems. 

University of Adelaide Design Brief in a nutshell
* 30% better than BCA
* design occupancy 700 people
* maximum outdoor air and natural light
* high volume exhaust air from six food outlets
* 24 hours/ 7 days

Plant Statistics
* 100% outdoor fresh air for cooling
* energy efficiency ratio of more than 10
* more than 70% electrical cost saving compared to chilled water system.
* environmentally friendly R718 refrigerant
* plug fans
* hydronic heating during winter

Project direct benefits
* Capital cost saving as no major upgrade to the power supply requirements when compared to Option 1 Chilled Water Plant
* Capital cost saving as no structure upgrade or underpinning of the foundation to the original 40 year old building
* Capital cost saving when compared to chilled water plant and variable refrigerant systems
* Operating and maintenance Life Cycle Cost saving (AS/NZS 4536:1999), when compared to
- chilled water plant
- packaged air conditioning
- split packaged air conditioning
- variable refrigerant systems

Call Huey on 04 8888 4839 for more details.

jobs.description:
HVAC and mechanical engineer. Designed the 'world most efficient' cooling plant. The iHMX cooling plant is at least 50% more efficient than a comparable chilled water system. At 45C external ambient, it can maintain an average of 22C indoor temperature.

The iHMX plant does not use refrigerant, this technology uses only fan power and heat mass exchanger for the cooling. Suited for shopping complexes, data centres, warehouses and atrium cooling.

Please contact Huey for your project requirements.

general.headline: Master Food Coach | Director at myfitbody | Fat Loss | Weight Management | Re-energising Program
general.description:
As a myfitbody weight loss lifestyle coach I offer you an alternative approach to the crash dieting methods often used by people wanting to lose weight. 

I have developed a proven and highly successful eating program based on simple and readily available foods and ingredients. 

myfitbody offers you a tailored lifestyle program, and as your personal coach I will be available to you 24/7 on the phone, or via sms or email. 

As a myfitbody coach I have the ability to identify and help you break down the barriers you face when dealing with weight loss.

jobs.description:
myfitbody is a company specialising in weight loss lifestyle coaching.
 
As the Australian population faces a growing ‘obesity’ epidemic, the team at myfitbody understands that unless the population is educated about the effect food has on your body, this epidemic will continue to grow.
 
myfitbody coaches recognise that lifestyles and eating habits have evolved over time. Lifestyles are busier than ever, with work, family, friends, social arrangements, co-curricular activities, hobbies, exercise and worst of all the continual increase of your daily chores. The hectic lifestyle we have today increases the importance of your daily fuel (energy) consumption. 

myfitbody coaches are here to guide, motivate and educate you by using effective and proven techniques that lead to gradual yet PERMANENT weight loss. You will never be hungry on one of our programs as you lose weight with our support in a comfortable, relaxed and trusting environment. Our aim is to ensure you lose weight and keep it off by establishing a healthy and sustainable lifestyle.

general.headline: Content Strategist at StartUp Foundation AU
general.description:
My favourite places attract visitors, build vibrant spaces for people to enjoy, treasure their heritage, celebrate their uniqueness, encourage new ideas, and aim to involve everyone in community life.

They shine because the whole is much greater than the sum of their parts.

Your town can excel too.

Revitalising business, restoring pride, redefining community - this is what Real Towns is all about.

How do we achieve this? By inspiring and empowering teams to build thriving communities with  digital technology, collaboration and innovation at their core.

It begins with an over-arching strategy to identify and promote a town's heritage, cultural and environmental uniqueness through integrated digital town marketing and traditional PR. We then combine the power of technology, training and storytelling to make your town stand out.

Why should you have confidence in the Real Towns system? As a former journalist, I understand what makes people tick and appreciate the importance of getting the right message to the right audience on their preferred channels when it matters.

As a digital strategist, I've worked extensively to build highly engaged digital communities on multiple channels in a wide range of industries.

With skills in keyword research, quality link building and site-wide content optimisation, I ensure websites are discoverable, insightful and engaging. 

I thrive on the challenge of growing a brand by creating a clear perception of its values, objectives, personality and individuality.

At Real Towns we keep up with the latest technology and thinking to develop new strategies which disrupt traditional markets and create new opportunities for our clients. 

As a founding director of Real Towns, I see a bright future for places which adopt a digital mindset and understand the power of storytelling.

Does your town need a reboot? You probably need Real Towns.

Want to know more? I invite you to ask me about the Real Towns approach.

jobs.description:
StartUp Foundation is a completely new type of startup accelerator. It is designed for you as a professional or corporate executive, to help you break free from corporate life, and become the entrepreneur youve often imagined.

We build on your acquired portfolio of talents, skills, know-how and networks. And enable you, as a professional, to tailor and create your own successful enterprise, especially in B2B/B2E markets.

What we can do to help you?
Our 5-stage program is designed for the challenges, lifestyle & responsibilities of the experienced professional in making the transition to successful entrepreneur.

We'll help you focus on your business model, strategy and personal development. And address how to overcome the personal & professional risks of starting your own enterprise mid-career. You will learn innovative resourcing, business engagement and strategic partnership methods, based on fair and equitable business models. 

So what do you want to build- a house of cards, or a home that everyone wants?

As Content Strategist, my role is to make sense of the countless blogs, social media posts, websites, books and events that belong to the Startup Foundation - then integrate and present them as a structured whole which is meaningful to the organisation and its many audiences. The role is part strategy and part technical. I work closely with the digital marketing lead, the CEO and the founder in this small team.

Since being invited to join the innovative Greenstorc team, my work has included market research, strategic market advice, along with provision of digital content, online marketing and publicity material. I am based in Melbourne and leading the company's push into the South Pacific and Australia by speaking with energy department heads, ministers and power utilities about Grenstorc's world-changing technology. We are in the process of developing microgrid heat-to-power and shallow geothermal solutions throughout Australia and the South Pacific region. Greenstorc Ltd, with head office in London, now has bases in Dusseldorf, Kenya, Melbourne and Panama.

Real Towns works with Councils, BIDs and Town Teams on digital town marketing plans, awesome content, digital skills training, community engagement strategies and implementing technologies that put places on the map.

We call it whole-town marketing with digital innovation at its core.

Don't know where your town fits on the Connected Spectrum? Take our Digital Health Check to find out.

We begin with a Strategy, put in place the right Technology, make sure people can use it by Training them, and share your narrative through expert Storytelling. 

The Real Towns system works. So let's get started.

jobs.jobTitle: Freelance journalist, blogger, social media commentator
jobs.description:
Source well credentialled opinions from respected subject matter experts, and verify facts about emerging trends in the social media industry. While, from time to time, I will promote companies, products or ideas that I think are worthy of attention, I will never blatantly give anyone a free plug for personal gain. Stay tuned for details of my blog.

I also write freelance stories for a variety of publications. I like to hear people's stories, no matter what they are, so long as they are authentic, preferably unique and of some value to my audience.

I have a good eye for what works and what doesn't in social media and know precisely how to get the right message to any audience.

ROI.com.au is a full service digital marketing company, whose primary focus before my arrival was delivering SEO & Adwords to SMEs.

I frequently use the following software and tools:
- WordPress
- Google Analytics
- BufferApp
- Hootsuite
- Keyword Planner
- Google Trends
- Mailchimp

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

* Research, write and post blog, newsletter, feature and opinion articles.
* Create an end-to-end Content Strategy, including visual, written and auditory.
* Generate effective social media strategies to drive audience interaction and website traffic.
* Create, document and sell social media packages to new and existing ROI clients usually via phone contact and presenting details in face-to-face meetings.
* Create and manage social media advertising campaigns for ROI and ROI clients.

KEY ACHIEVEMENTS

* Built a recurring monthly revenue base of $20,000 from scratch, and a recurring pipeline of leads bringing in at least the same amount every month from one-off leads generated via eDMs using Mailchimp and through one of Australia's most read digital marketing blogs.
* Enabled a major Australian gym network to quadruple leads via targeted Facebook advertising and conversion campaigns.
* Created content marketing and social media marketing campaigns that generated direct leads for a range of services into ROI.com.au, including SEO, social media marketing, content marketing and Responsive web design.
* Grew a major Australian tour company's Facebook fan base from scratch to more than 1500 in 6 months through clever PPC and audience targeting, while increasing clicks to their website five-fold and subscriptions to their newsletter by hundreds in a single month.
* Doubled traffic in a month to the blog pages of a large Australian used car buyer by reaching out to enthusiasts on Twitter and Facebook, delivering fresh blog content, establishing relationships with Webmasters of websites with complementary audiences and spearheading a reinvigorated eDM campaign.

Pat is currently working with social media sales and marketing guru Tim Williams to improve his communication skills via Linked-In, Twitter and You-Tube to generate more networking and business opportunities. Pat is developing innovative ways to tailor social media strategies with measurable and guaranteed outcomes.

· Social Media Marketing using Twitter, YouTube and LinkedIn
· Developing better Social Media profiles for Twitterand LinkedIn
· Using YouTube videos to increase sales
· Building connections fast and making them work better for you
· How to make money and improve your career prospects using Social Media

Pat was the senior journalist on a number of suburban newspaper publications at the Leaders Newspaper Group. Pat wrote feature and news articles on a range of issues, specifically covering police rounds, court reporting, Local Government, community affairs, State and Federal Government stories.

Pat was chosen as the assistant editor for a new London-based trade magazine titled "Newspaper Focus". This publication was targeted towards the newspaper and magazine industries. Here I was the lead architect with seven contract extensions and was responsible for providing the architecture for an enterprise solution that encapsulated the workflow from signing an artist through to preparing products via manufacturers and printers to ship to customers.  This involved a considerable amount of workflow analysis and business re-engineering covering the entire life cycle. My responsibilities included:
1. Architectural feasibility and solution definition incorporating dependency integration, process definition, proof of concepts, project plans/cost estimates, vendor engagements, presentations 
2. Architectural definition and reviews, configuration management process definition (build and deployment), integration
3. Analysis – use cases, process definition, process re-engineering, usability testing, and robustness analysis, workflow diagrams
4. Design – Rational Rose producing system diagrams, class diagrams, sequence diagrams, etc
5. Development/integration – J2EE, WebLogic 7, JBuilder 6.0, Java 1.4, EJB 1.2 (2000 classes), Web Services, SOAP, JDBC, JMS, JSP, EWork, XML, Business Objects, log4j, VSS
6. Testing and deployment – JUnit, Apache Tomcat 3.2.4, Apache Ant 1.4
7. Mentoring and deployment of object-oriented process (RUP), tools, and standards

schools.description: PhD enttled "An Object-oriented method for Evolving and Evaluating Object-oriented Design Metric Models".The principal contribution of this thesis is the development of an object-oriented method with supporting software for evolving and evaluating object-oriented design metric models.  This thesis is grounded in a formal arithmetical model of object-orientation and an object-oriented metric model.  Combined , these models uniquely providean agile and innovative mechanisms for the explicit elicitation of the essential elements of a well formed metric-model, and embodies these as reusable operational components.

Synopsis:

Australia operated under a negative credit reporting system which limits the credit providers to provide, store and report only negative credit information of a consumer. The passing of the Privacy Amendment Bill 2012 in Parliament, December 2012 introduced changes including comprehensive credit reporting. general.description:
Working in digital marketing, content strategy and athlete education, with 15+ years experience in the sport, media, entertainment and tech industries.

Using technology to reach, inform and entertain audiences. Delivering value to athletes, clubs, leagues, brands and fans. Encouraging athletes to show vulnerability, be themselves, discover their purpose and understand their influence.

jobs.description:
We connect athletes to content, and brands to their audience.

Unscriptd is a sports technology and athlete media company that connects athletes to content, providing reach, engagement and revenue for athletes, clubs, leagues, rights holders and brands.

We exist to amplify the athlete, by enabling them to become world class publishers of quality content that engages and grows their audience for the benefit of their personal brand and our commercial partners (clubs, leagues, brands, agents, rights holders).

Our unique proprietary technology allows athletes to simplify the creation, distribution and measurement of that content at scale and across multiple social channels simultaneously.

My role connects the world's best athletes with quality content, to reach, engage, commercialise and entertain audiences.

• Mentoring athletes to show vulnerability, discover their purpose, understand their influence
• Developing technology to simplify the creation, distribution and measurement of content
• Delivering value to athletes, clubs, leagues, agents, brands, rights holders and fans

general.headline: Chief Marketing Officer | CX Marketing Solutions |  Strategy Board Member | Global CMO Top 40  | CMO Top 20 Australia
general.description:
Sitting at the intersection of commerciality and creativity, my approach to marketing is united by an unrelenting customer focus. Viewing everything through the lens of the customer, I develop roadmaps underpinned by what I call my ‘Four Cs’: Customers; Content; Channels; Consistency. I leverage data for facts, while seeking the hidden human narrative. From this platform, I formulate bespoke marketing, brand and digital strategies that deliver multimillion-dollar impacts on top and bottom line performance. 

My area of expertise may be marketing and communications, but my real obsession is ‘listening’ – to clients, customers and colleagues. I proactively elicit feedback and insights to distil, rebuild and invigorate the purpose, mission, vision and values of global brands. By bringing everyone into the discussion, I create value propositions, solutions and integrated marketing campaigns that win not only endorsement, but loyalty. My mantra is simple: Listen, Act, Deliver. 

My personal goal is to inspire, and I believe inspiration starts from within. I encourage the CEOs I work with, and all in the executive team, to think deeply about their impact, role and privileged leadership position. Manifest in how my role with NASDAQ listed NDY (a Tetra Tech company) has expanded into the realm of digital enterprise solutions, CSR, internal communications and People & Culture, I build influence for myself, my peers and my brands through trust and ethical behaviour, uniting people through a common purpose to deliver on their promise to our customers. This, after all, is the key to high performance. 

If you would like to connect, please get in touch via LinkedIn or by email.

jobs.description:
Briefed to establish a global marketing and comms function from the ground-up, I have defined a modern vision and customer-centred brand proposition that has increased brand awareness, customer loyalty, revenues and profit margins. Driving a program of brand and digital transformation, I have delivered a comprehensive 5-year strategy, executing pioneering digital solutions, global content marketing campaigns relaunching NDY across markets. Leading 8 global teams spanning bids & tenders, insights & NPS, marketing comms and social & digital work streams, I also lead strategic projects across the marketing spectrum to establish NDY as a true innovator in the sector.  

•	Delivered client focused solutions that have achieved a 700% uplift in brand awareness, a 7-11 point increase in profit and greater market share across ANZ and the UK
•	Delivered a full suite of CX/digital solutions including a voice of the customer platform
•	Created a compelling EVP that uplifted staff engagement by 9%, winning a 2018 Employer of Choice Award
•	Established NDY’s charitable trust and continue to lead CSR (including diversity) activities, globally
•	Recognised as a Top 20 CMO in Australia and Global Top 40 CMO by the World Marketing Congress.

Throughout, I provided leadership to direct reports and consultants across business development, marketing, communications and digital, and provided expert advisory to members in matters relating to reputation, branding and customer experience.

•	Increased the client base by 62% and turnover by 350%, executing 40 campaigns embodying the reformed mission and brand livery
•	Designed and implemented a new digital platform for members, industry and government access that improved operational efficiency by 300%
•	Elevated brand awareness by 300%, supporting a 200% increase in overseas work enquires for clients.

My focus was on the effective execution of a C-level industry engagement agenda, underpinning the development of a united 2050 vision for infrastructure in Australia.

•	Organised a 2-day summit for influential leaders across sectors, resulting in a range of initiatives, plans and recommendations informing the government’s 2050 vision for public infrastructure spend.

Engaged by Australia’s peak industry association, I consulted on commercially-charged strategies promoting ‘smart manufacturing’ and Australian products across Asian and European markets.

•	Secured seed funding from the Victorian Government to further support biotech and pharma sectors
•	Received commendation from the Trade Minister for the calibre of work undertaken.

reinvention of a number of  the Australia Beverages Council’s key marketing messages. general.headline: Architect at Peddle Thorp Melbourne Pty Ltd
general.description:
During my career so far I have worked in the health and education sectors on projects ranging from early childhood centers, primary & secondary schools (public & private), tertiary education facilities to a hospital refurbishment. These projects involved structural surveying and documentation of subsequent strengthening, complete new builds and repurposing of existing building stock.

Commercially, my portfolio of work includes the national role out of a fitness center franchise throughout New Zealand, the heritage restoration of an airport, planning & documentation of state wide service centers and fast food chain restaurant spaces, and various other office and retail buildings and fitouts.

A generous share of my experience in Melbourne has centered on the design and documentation of large scale multi story mixed use residential projects in the greater Melbourne area. My role in these projects also branched off into preparation of the marketing materials and lead interior designer. My Melbourne experience has also exposed me to involvement in the the design and documentation of an aquarium in China.

My current role is within the Sports and Leisure team where we are working on multiple aquatic and sporting centers within Australia and internationally. The sheer number of projects managed within our team means that on a daily basis my role can vary from preparation of concept presentations for various stakeholders and planning documentation, to liaising with consultants in relation to documentation, to aspects of contract administration on more advanced projects.

general.description:
Zandi is motivated to further her personal and professional growth involving the development of her experience in the Construction industry. She takes pleasure in developing new business opportunities whilst being a part of a united team culture. 

After spending 17 years in Europe, she returned to life in Australia. She then commenced employment with Metricon Homes and her newest role as Referral Manager (Business to Business) entails the development of Metricon’s Referral program which is a new business model for Metrcion. Her role involves identifying potential business partners for Metricon and key relationship building with external companies and internal team members. 

Zandi holds Diplomas in Building & Construction and Interior Design along with Small Business Management and a trade qualification. Her industry experience has seen her working locally, interstate and in Europe in the fields of Construction, Sales, Design and Colour. 

Zandi presents herself professionally and with genuine warmth. general.description:
The Group is particularly keen to assist immigrants to accelerate economic growth in Africa, Asia and other developing continents by facilitating land transactions whilst in diaspora. We are working towards creating easily accessible and transferable leverage land products as well as creating and maintaining an instant liquidation market for all products purchased by the clients in diaspora. We estimate the land marketplace capitalisation for the global migrant community to be more than USD 250 billion per year.

The potential to permanently solve land acquisition problems to the diaspora client is almost guaranteed by  incorporating blockchain technology to our systems. It is exciting to work with experts around the world to deliver a platform supported by Ethereum,  creating trust in a seemingly trustless land marketplace.

general.headline: Community Manager at Social Empire Group
general.description:
Hey I'm Mike,

At Social Empire I help Personal Trainers, Start Up Business and Offline Service Based Businesses through our exclusive 12 week program that injects our Viral Loop Online Marketing System straight into the heart of your business, setting you up with a customised viral sales funnel designed to not only drive sales, but fuel growth in every aspect of your business.

So if you are:

● An expert in your field who provides a lot of value to people.
● Stressed out by online, it scares you - you are a people person. You don’t understand the whole online space.
● Sick of trading time for money.
● Have wasted time and money on online strategies that just havent worked.
● Suffering from information overload, you don’t know what to do and you have no direction.
● Struggling to get noticed in a crowded space.
● Stuck in a rut where your business revolves around you. You have no system.
● Looking for a scalable model.
● Need to grow your online presence.
● Have a great product in a niche, but have no idea about how to launch it to the
world.

Our solution solves all these problems...

The key aspect of the Viral Loop System is taking the offline word of mouth marketing principle and bringing it online.

This allows the referrals to be passed from ‘one to many’, instead of the slow ‘one to one’ process of offline word of mouth.

This duplication model can be used as the sole way to market a business, but when used in conjunction with other methods, it multiplies every other marketing effort x10.

Find out how in our free webinar at ➤➤ http://socialempire.com.au/webinar

Cheers,

Mike!

general.headline: NAB / Viral Blogger - Inspiring the world through Personal Development and Entrepreneurship.
general.description:
I am a viral blogger currently reaching more than 30M readers a month. I write for Entrepreneur.com, Addicted2Success.com, Startup Grind, and The Mission on Medium.com

Over the last few years, I’ve had multiple posts on social media go viral with millions of engagement. I don’t tell you that to impress you; I tell you that because I’d have to be an idiot not to have worked out by now what inspires people and how to tell stories. 

By day, I also work for National Australia Bank. I do three things in this role: 
1.	Help iconic tech companies setup in Australia
2.	Facilitate Fintech Partnerships
3.	Advise Australian companies who want to expand offshore

My two line vision for my life is:
To inspire the world through entrepreneurship and personal development. 

My beliefs that drive everything I do are:
-	Anything is possible
-	Positivity trumps all
-	Challenging the status quo 
-	Ego is the enemy
-	Always be kind, grateful and a good person

How can I help you?
-    If you are a tech company going to new markets, then we should chat.
-    If you are a Fintech company and want to navigate the banking system, then we should chat. 
-    If you want to up your game in social media, then I can help. 
-    If you are obsessed with personal development, then we’ll probably become friends quickly. 

### YOU CAN CONTACT ME VIA  http://timdenning.net/

jobs.description:
My team are a small group of intrapreneurs who are passionate about global online business and want to be thought leaders in this space.

As an Associate Director within NAB’s Global eCommerce and Advisory team, it is my role to assist overseas technology / eCommerce companies to setup in Australia. I also support Australian Online Businesses to go overseas and be able to scale quickly. 

As well as the advisory piece it's my responsibility to help NAB partner with payment companies under an introducer, payment facilitator or ISO (Independent Sales Organisation) agreement. 

If you would like to have an informal chat about strategies for entering the Australian market or taking an online business offshore, please feel free to contact me at tim.denning@nab.com.au

Working as a Transaction Banking Specialist I specialise in assisting startups and

      knowledgable in referral partnerships and large existing tech businesses that are
      
      already successful. The environment I work in lets me solve problems in m

In this role I was responsible for developing new business in the receivables, payables
      and cash management space. In this role it was important to be invovled in the tech
      
      space and regularly attend investment / ecommerce events.

Responsible for providing advice around different types of insurance products. I dealt
      alot with high net wealth individuals and Senior NAB Staff who required tailored
      insurance options to meet their needs. The role required me to regularly speak with
      
      insurance underwriters to determine the adequate level of risk and coverage.

Entrepreneur.com receives over *** 25 Million Views *** a month and is the hub for entrepreneurs worldwide. Coming from a successful startup background, I love to share my experience and learning's with other entrepreneurs. 

By being able to produce my own content that is distributed globally, I get to achieve my life long goal of inspiring the world through entrepreneurship and personal development.

Outside of my normal business day, I love writing advice articles for Addicted2Success.com 

The site has over  ***  3 MILLION VIEWS  ***  per month and what impresses me the most is the engagement on social media. There are a high amount of shares on all platforms rather than just likes or followers.

I pride myself in trying to find the best possible advice through recorded interviews with successful entrepreneurs and businesses. Once we have crowdsourced the strength of the articles advice, we then look to do follow up articles, podcasts and videos based on what our subscribers want. 

Having been involved in a successful startup, I enjoy giving back to the community of entrepreneurs and sharing my lessons, as well as other startups lessons so that they can prosper as quickly as possible. The purpose of the blog is not to flood our subscribers with content, but to give them quality content, in digestible chunks, that they can actually use. If it means we go a whole day without a new article being posted, we are okay with that as long as what we are posting is quality. 

Being involved with the blog has really inspired me a lot and I too get to learn lessons whilst conducting the interviews. If you think there is a founder/ business that might be interesting to feature, please drop me a line on LinkedIn.

One of the largest, most shared publications on Medium read by millions globally each
      month. The publication publishes stories about personal development, accelerated
      
      learning, technology, and definite optimism.

general.headline: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Expert
general.description:
I am an experienced, Melbourne-based data scientist and machine learning expert with strong interests in applying machine learning techniques, statistical models, open source software, and cloud-based technologies to solve interesting and novel business problems.

I earned my Master of Science (Research) degree at the Centre for Astrophysics and Supercomputing at Swinburne University. During my postgraduate career investigating the role of cluster mergers on galaxy evolution, I developed skills in mathematical and statistical analysis, computer programming, algorithm design, big data, image and signal processing, communicating results, and mentoring students.

Since graduation, I have worked on data science projects for many high-profile companies including 7-Eleven, Australian Gas Networks (AGN), Bunnings, Mazda, RMIT, South East Water, Telstra, and the Water Board of Western Australia. While working on these projects, I developed a strong interest in machine learning and artificial intelligence and self-taught myself R, Python, and other relevant machine learning packages to solve the business problems I encountered along the way.

general.headline: CHIEF DISRUPTION OFFICER (CDO) AT CAREER INSIGHT
general.description:
"I ASPIRE TO INSPIRE BEFORE I EXPIRE."

As Chief Disruption Officer (CDO), I look beyond what's obvious and look for opportunities that are on trend. My "dual" ability to look at the big picture, whilst still being a genuine pragmatist ensures real innovation. A natural orchestrator, I can recognise areas of collaboration between various clients, groups and partners. Overall I am a change management leader that thrives at the intersection of IT and business.

My sole purpose is to achieve the best outcomes for my clients. I listen. I observe. I create. I empower. I deliver.  I know how to translate aspiration into action.

My company, Career Insight, offers a diverse range of products including: resume writing, interview coaching, psychometric testing, outplacement services, professional development and accredited / non accredited training (focused on cross-group relations, behaviours management, remuneration and rewards), and workforce enhancement consulting.

Why should you contact me? The world today is vastly different. It is high stakes and competition is tough. One needs to stand out through the disruption of accepted "norms." Critically, my work is very much about future-proofing aspirations. This "disruption" is what is necessary to ensure achievable goals. 

Thus, I am that change agent that can serve as a bridge between strategy, process and technology. I work with jobseekers to prepare them for the open market. I work with recruiters to freely refer candidates who meet their criteria and I work with employers to help resolve unique workforce  issues.

There is a strategic advantage working together. This is because "aspiration matters" to me. Contact me for a FREE introduction:

- LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/in/stevedelrosario
- Mobile: +61 400 820 675
- Email: steve@careerinsight.com.au
- Skype: thecareeralist (Steve del Rosario)
- Website: www.careerinsight.com.au

jobs.description:
Career Insight is a specialist training, consulting and online support organisation that provides a range of career management services to employers, recruiters and jobseekers. As CDO, I am both the Principal Consultant and Managing Director of the brand. Career Insight's services focus on:

- Assisting local and international employers, agencies, communities and individuals with professional and personal development services- especially in career development, workforce strategy management, talent coaching, mentoring and counselling. 

- Guiding employers on how best to identify, select, and harness the immense intellectual property brought to our shores by migrant professionals. It also provides highly technical strategic insight in how best to develop and tailor HR training, environments, products and services to suit the emerging and powerful migrant consumer / employee market.

- Providing a candidate referral service to recruitment agencies keen to use the independent expertise of a qualified career counselling firm. No vacancy is too hard as current recruitment partners can attest to the  benefits of using the vast database of skilled professionals on Career Insight's database.

- Offering an array of customised / personalised services to assist individual jobseekers including: unemployment management training, professional confidante services, personal / personality development, soft skills coaching, application writing services, networking and community / corporate engagement referrals and internship programs.

If following the "norm" hasn't worked for you, then call us. A disruption in the system is needed to help change your career prospects.

schools.description: I undertook the TAE as it is a prerequisite to have to facilitate accredited training in the VET sector

My inspiration undertaking an Arts degree came down to my circumstances as a migrant growing up in Australia. I wanted to know how the world worked. Like many who came from difficult backgrounds I was in unfamiliar territory. I was in fact the first in my family to go to university. I undertook subjects about science, the law, politics and philosophy in the hope of not just better understanding the world, but also myself. Who I am today is a testimony of the knowledge I acquired during my studies.

A social media, marketing and strategy expert, Sarah Jane also works as the Fashion & Beauty Editor for Latte Magazine. jobs.description:
Mummies Who Lunch is more than just cucumber sandwiches and soy chai lattes. It’s about women connecting with other women, in what can be some of the hardest and best times of their lives – pregnancy, birth and raising their little people. 

An avid ‘girl power’ kinda-gal, Sarah Jane Young set out to create a space where women can come together and be the best person they can be. Sarah Jane believes that a mummy’s true confidence starts with her support system and always knowing she is not alone in the journey that is parenthood. She has also always been a big believer in the power of the ‘sisterhood’, and this only deepened after the arrival of her daughter in May 2015. At times feeling confused, overwhelmed and isolated in those early days, Sarah Jane was inspired to bring together other like-minded mummies to share and grow in their experiences. 

The philosophies behind Mummies Who Lunch are simple: no one baby, mother or dynamic is the same and therefore no one routine or method will necessarily work. Mummies Who Lunch is an empowering and judgement-free space, but also one where you can let your hair down. It’s an opportunity for women to share their experiences with their peers, but ultimately have the confidence to then trust in their own instincts and judgement. There is no such thing as a right or wrong way, and no question is a silly one. Mummies Who Lunch is also all about the mummy who wants to look and feel great. 

Mummies Who Lunch will be running fortnightly social catch-ups, with workshops to follow in the months ahead. All workshops have been specifically designed to make each and every participant feel empowered in their choices as a mother.

www.sheissarahjane.com.au // @sheis_sarahjane // facebook.com/SISJBLOG

She is, Sarah Jane (SISJ) is a Melbourne based fashion, beauty & lifestyle blog.

general.headline: 🌟 Mindset & Business Coach | 🌟 Mentor to high-level executives | 🎤 International Speaker | 🌟 Consultant to entrepreneurs who want a purpose filled business & life | 🎙️ Host to Tima the Podcast
general.description:
⬇️ MY BIGGER MISSION ⬇️
 
"I help people around the world to truly understand that their potential is limitless.  Most importantly, I inspire those to take action to be that person they have always wanted to be & live that life they always wanted to have.” - #yourpotentialislimitless
 
 
🔷 Consultant / Mentor / Coach 🔷
 
Jim Rohn once said "One of the greatest gifts you can give to anyone is the gift of attention " and this philosophy is the cornerstone of my service delivery.  My consulting/mentoring/coaching clients command my full attention as I work in partnership with them to help provide them with clarity, fulfillment and bring their business & lifestyle goals to life.
 
If you have seen any of my videos I do sound sweet, however I make sure that ALL of my clients are accountable.
 
 
🔷 Speaker / MC / Host 🔷
 
# As a SPEAKER # 

I deliver a number of key notes...some of the topics include:

➡️ Growth vs Fixed Mindset
➡️ The rise of the Intrapreneur
➡️ How to start the right business
➡️ How to create goals and follow through
 
# As a HOST/MC #

This service is all about you, your brand, your story & your why.
 
Whatever your mission, vision & values are, my priority is to be there for you, represent your organisations brand and effectively communicate this to your audience in a fun & engaging way.
 
I will ensure that your audience is having fun and I will create an environment where your audience will be able to establish new life long connections with others in the room.
 
It is my mission to instil the feeling of inspiration and motivation (to TAKE ACTION) in each person present in the room.
 
 
🔷 Podcast 🔷
 
My vision to help others truly understand that their potential is limitless, has inspired me to communicate this message not only on stage but also via my Podcast.
 
In my series "Deconstructed Entrepreneur" I interview those that have created something from nothing to inspire you to take action.  
 
Please DM me for any enquiries.

jobs.description:
As an independent business owner my commitment is to the delivery of tangible results that build the financial security of clients and align with their unique vision. I have a passion for my work as a business succession planner and bring energy, enthusiasm and commercial acumen to all strategic planning sessions.

With clients representing a diversity of industries from retail and fashion to property developers, tradesmen and manufacturing I am recognised for an approach that is meticulous and detailed in nature providing professional expertise in the following suite of services: 

•	Family & Business Succession Planning.
•	Self-Managed Superannuation Funds Strategies.
•	Asset Protection & Security.
•	Estate Planning Strategies.
•	Insurance. 
•	Investments. 
•	Key Note Presentations

I thoroughly enjoy the opportunity to work with and educate people to strengthen their financial acumen and am a regular presenter with the South East Business Network, leading workshops to women about superannuation and to business owners about succession planning.

At TIMA Designs I conceptualised the design and development of the Tima Designs fashion label focused on feminine, sophisticated, chic and elegant fashion pieces for the corporate and glamorous woman.

Managing all aspects of the business from design, production and quality assurance to sales, marketing and distribution provided the opportunity to understand the intricacies and nuances of small business development in a highly competitive industry.

The business success was based on a commitment to quality and integrity of design and an innate understanding of the fashion needs of the corporate woman.  This is reflected in the label being stocked in a number of high-end fashion boutiques across Melbourne.

Additionally, in my work I delivered presentations to audiences that included:

•	International Women’s Day – “A World of Fashion”  -a presentation on running 2 businesses in   fashion and financial planning and how to achieve success.
•	Inspirational Women Program on Foxtel, an interview discussion on combining fashion, business and financial planning.

Responsible for leading the Dandenong Chapter of Heart Link, a women’s networking group focused on linking resources, new ideas, products and services amongst professional women.
 
Professional Contributions

Membership Participation: Through ensuring a fun, collaborative and empowering environment I was able to consistently grow the network of members across the chapter.

Leadership: Was able to facilitate strong connections between women in business that helped create opportunities to build their business, knowledge and professional networks.

As a Senior Business Financial Planner I was recruited to build and grow the financial planning services of the Dandenong Business Centre.

Professional Contributions

•	Business Development: Established trust and respect across the banking division, opening channels of communication and ensuring excellence in customer service to internal and external stakeholders which resulted in the considerable growth and contribution of the financial planning division across the Business Centre.

•	Revenue Generation: Steadily achieved growth in clients and portfolio revenue ensuring consistent ranking in the ANZ Top 20 Business Financial Planner leader board.

•	Business Succession Planning: Identified and developed the opportunity to provide Business Succession planning as an additional service/product for the business.

•	Professional Development: Nominated by senior management to complete the SMSF course.

•	Customer Service Standards: I assisted with the development and creation of the Statement of Advice layout for the business client, working across the compliance team to ensure that it was a user friendly and functional planning tool.

•	Management: I was regularly appointed to the acting manager role, responsible for leading and building on the team performance.  In line with this, I participated in a number of management meetings at a state and national level focused on developing the service delivery and product range of the financial planning division.

Initially appointed into the Business Direct Division I was subsequently promoted to the Commercial Banking providing strategic financial planning advice to small to medium enterprises.

Professional Contributions

•	Customer Service: I was consistently recognised for my ability to build rapport and trust with a diverse network of clients from sole traders to larger enterprises with increasing complexity of financial planning requirements.

•	Stakeholder Management: Established a strong network of referral/business partners including Relationship Managers, Investment Bankers, Merchant Bankers etc. with recognition for ensuring a collaborative focus on achieving the most optimal outcome for clients.

•	“Ruby Network” Champion: I was highly involved in the “Ruby Network” for Women in Business, delivering presentations and co-ordinating events to educate women on financial planning, particularly in the areas of superannuation, self-managed super funds, insurance and business growth/protection.

As Business Development Manager I was recruited to build the broker network from a zero base.

Professional Contributions

Business Development: Through persistence, determination and excellence in customer service established a dynamic network of brokers that delivered outstanding revenue growth for the business. 

Sales: Consistently achieved high sales results and supported the organisation in the development and marketing of financial products responsive to the market needs.

general.headline: Neurosurgeon & Founder of Anatomics
general.description:
Mr Paul S D'Urso is a Neurosurgeon and the Founder & Executive Chairman of the Anatomics group of companies in Melbourne, Australia.

Mr D'Urso's unique experience in research, clinical practice, teaching, commercialisation and medico-legal opinion has made him an internationally recognised Australian neurosurgeon, scientist, and innovator. 

Mr D'Urso invented the technology of BioModelling with groundbreaking PhD research and founded Anatomics, one of the worlds most innovative medical software & device companies in 1995. Anatomics is a non profit company that has helped many thousands of severely affected patients and is committed to implementing the vision of 'Community Based Personalised Healthcare' via it's AnatomicsRx software architecture.

Mr D’Urso was a fellow at the Cambridge University Neurosurgery unit and a clerk at Harvard Medical School.  He has published and presented over 130 scientific papers, holds multiple international patents and has won over 30 prestigious research prizes. 

As a medical practitioner for over 28 years, Mr D’Urso has accumulated a wealth of experience at Court in all jurisdictions. Mr D'Urso provides expert opinion for plaintiffs, defendants and for the Crown and is accredited by prestigious medico-legal opinion services.

jobs.description:
Captivating Melbourne Burlesque artist Sina King takes centre stage in this
      kaleidoscopic exploration of dance, fashion and art.
      

    
      

    Collaborating with multi-faceted artist Jake Stollery, these two talented Melburnian
      creatives combine sensual silhouettes with dynamic animation and an ever-changing
      
      palette of fashion textiles to create a stylish suite of graphic projections.

Sina was the third woman in Australian history to be invited to compete for the
      industries most coveted award at the Burlesque Hall of Fame in Las Vegas, Nevada.
      
      Only ten artists from around the world are invited each year.

Known as 'The Royal Captivator', Sina King is regarded as one of Australia’s best burlesque artists has performed on the biggest burlesque stages in the world.
As creative powerhouse, King began her career in 2011 after her first performance saw her crowned winner of Australia’s prestigious ‘Miss Burlesque Australia’ taking the industry and the media by storm.  In June 2015, King represented the Southern Hemisphere in Las Vegas at the world ‘s largest and most revered burlesque event where she competed for ‘Reigning Queen of Burlesque'.
King's high glamour and unique performances have been seen at at A-list events, private parties of Cirque du Soleil, the Viennese Life Ball, on 42nd Street, many historical European theatres, international festivals, and of course, The Burlesque Hall of Fame in Las Vegas.
Despite her globetrotting, King loves her home country and has toured performing in every major city and has inspired many as coach and mentor along the way.  Off stage, King is a passionate modern pinup, producer, and Creative Director. 
Sina is available for bookings via her website www.misssinaking.com or email management@misssinaking.com

general.headline: Company Director at BPM
general.description:
Curating inspiration from an acute eye for style and over 19 years in the industry, Director Jonathan Hallinan has built a reputation for delivering exceptional developments that echo authentic architecture and design integrity.

With a sincere focus on the impact of BPM developments on the local environs, Hallinan has lead his team in delivering progressive and sustainable living options for those seeking the ultimate lifestyle – an ethos which has been embraced nationally.

For each project, Hallinan surrounds himself with the best possible talent across interior design; landscaping and architecture to ensure all elements of the ‘home’ are given the best chance to shine. And the result – purchasers are presented with a luxurious space featuring natural light, expansive living areas, beautiful gardens, and importantly, excellent investment value.

jobs.description:
Since establishing BPM in 1995, Jonathan Hallinan has risen to become one of Australia’s most influential entrepreneurs and business commentators. 

As founder and managing director of property development firm, BPM, Hallinan actively manages a $1.4 billion pipeline of residential projects across Australia, including vertically integrated businesses in property management, construction and finance. 

With a background in construction, Hallinan purchased his first property in Melbourne at just age 19 following completion of his carpentry apprenticeship. This was the start of an insatiable appetite for property, which led Hallinan to grow BPM into a global business, with a strong presence across Asia and offices is Los Angeles, where Hallinan is acquiring development sites.

Hallinan’s vision for the BPM World has also gained momentum with further brand extensions including the inception of a BPM Café, Hotel, Champagne Bar and Health & Fitness, each of which will be owned and operated by Hallinan and debut at BPM’s biggest project to date: Shadow Play. 

Shadow Play, a $300 million residential tower in Melbourne’s Southbank, is Hallinan’s most recent accomplishment and the realization of his lifelong dream to make an architectural impact on the skyline of Australian cities.  

“Shadow Play represents the evolution of BPM from being purely a property brand, into a complete lifestyle, extending it from just the physical parameters of a building into an enriching lifestyle approach accessible to anyone seeking a life of indulgence, beauty and desire” says Hallinan. 
 
“Property purchasers are now more active in the luxury space then ever before – seeking the niche, the new and the next. They want to share their knowledge with peers and engage with brands and properties that reflect their own attachment with design and culture."

“Everyone seeks a life of beauty and luxury, and through BPM’s developments, I am making this achievable and affordable for everyone."

general.headline: Leadership Development & Team Performance Trainer, Speaker, Coach, Mentor, Facilitator
general.description:
I am an expert in leadership and team performance. With over a decade of experience in Operations and Call Center’s across the banking industry I am focused on maximizing efficiency and building high performance team cultures. 

I work with leaders and teams to increase:
•	Individual productivity 
•	Staff retention and engagement
•	Customer satisfaction
•	Advocacy for change

With a key focus around:
•	Building authentic relationships and establishing a high level of trust
•	Generating respect by having ‘challenging’ conversations, inspiring debate and healthy dialogue
•	Holding themselves and the people they work with accountable
•	Empowering their staff to make decisions and drive results through influence (instead of authority) 
•	Understanding their direction and how it aligns with the direction of the organisation

I achieve this through:
•	Leadership Coaching (ICF Accredited)
•	Training
•	Team Facilitation 
•	Group Mentoring
•	Event Speakership 

Client comments:

“This experience has changed the way I approach my work, making it more meaningful” Mary – Team Leader – Not-for-Profit

“I have completed a lot of professional development activities, throughout my career and I can honestly say that until Shelley’s program, I never truly applied all I had learnt.” Brylie – Team Manager - Government

“She has a very good approach of looking ahead while keeping a grasp on reality and perspective” Andrew – Manager – Telecommunications

“I learnt how to approach my job with more confidence, to appreciate the value of change and flexible thinking, to be more efficient, to differentiate between what I want to do and what I need to do, and to recognize my weaknesses and use simple strategies to overcome them.” Dominic – Supervisor – Critical Infrastructure

To see how I can help you or your organisation contact me at shelley@shelleyflett.com or call on 0407 522 888.
