general.headline: Founder and Director of Boost Juice Bars and Retail Zoo, investor on the Channel TEN's Shark Tank and podcast co host
general.description:
Janine Allis is founder of Boost Juice Bars, which has more outlets in more countries than any other juice bar in the world. Janine is among Australia’s most respected business women, having been presented through her business numerous domestic and international awards in digital marketing, retail, franchise and business. In 2015, business magazine BRW named her one of fifteen people that changed the way Australia does business in the last 35 years.

Her vision is to “do retailing differently”, delivering a unique customer experience based on the “love life” philosophy. In 2000, the first Boost Juice opened its doors in Adelaide, South Australia.  18 years on Boost Juice has over 500 stores in 14 countries, having turned over more than $2 billion since inception. Boost Juice Bars is now an Australian icon that achieved an incredible 95% brand awareness rating in the first five years of existence.   
Janine’s view of the customer experience and thinking outside the square has helped to achieve continued growth year on year. Boost Juice leads the way in digital marketing, smashing records with reach and engagement in all social media platforms, Boost is now used as a bench mark for other retailers on how to market using digital.     
Retail Zoo was created in 2007 to grow young food retail brands using their expertise and solid back end to grow.   In 2007 RZ purchased then four-store Salsa’s Fresh Mex Grill, which has grown to 40 stores Australia wide and acquired CIBO Espresso in December 2012 which continues to grow year on year.

Based in Melbourne, Janine is a mother of four and advocate for a healthy lifestyle – she maintains a five-day-a-week yoga practice and she is a very average surfer and tennis player...but loves both. 

Janine is a bestselling author of The Accidental Entrepreneur which was launched in 2016, and she features on Channel TEN’s, Shark Tank as an investor and podcast co host with Margie Hartley on 'Superwomen we ain't'.

general.headline: CEO at Virgin Mobile
general.description:
An experienced CEO with strong combination of strategic and operational leadership skills in Information, Communication and Technology industry across Europe, Australia, USA and Middle East. 

Over the past 20 years, Fouad has developed businesses and led teams and organizations to substantial growth rates, achieving over 30% market share and positive EBITDA during the first year of operation in any market. A firm believer of ‘making change happen’ and ‘leading by example’, Fouad has successfully launched various telecommunication brands across multiple regions, handled complex business situations, lead teams to reach the summit and implemented sound strategies to drive competition out and secure sustainable business growth. 

Having joined Virgin Mobile Middle East & Africa as CEO since October 2015, Fouad has already led the organisation, in KSA, towards triple growth potential in revenue, margin, ARPU and subscriber base, creating long term sustainable shareholders’ value. Fouad’s leadership style is intellectual, experiential and creative. He is the leader of leaders, continuously striving for innovation and creativity that are kept at the core of the brand and operation. 

Fouad is a proven leader with deep-rooted expertise in setting up operations, building outstanding teams, driving growth, and bringing a disciplined focus to operations and execution.

Core Skills: • P&L Management & Improvement, Post-Merger Integration, Leadership and Team Building, Change Management, Strategic Planning and Execution, Organizational Consolidations, Finance and Budgetary Control, Business Process Reengineering, Business Expansion, Innovation, Intellectual, Creative and Experiential Leadership

jobs.jobTitle: Digital & Technical Recruiter (Deputy Manager Human Resources)
jobs.description:
•	Recruiting for UI/ UX Designers, Digital Marketing, SEO / SEM Specialists, Web/ Mobile Product Managers, Software Developers (Java and .Net) and Project Managers.

•	Working closely with internal stakeholders to deeply understand role requirements. Establishing and maintaining meaningful relationships with them. 
•	Reviewing and screening candidate applications to determine their knowledge, skills and abilities for the role.
•	Assessing candidates suitability through a combination of testing and behavioural-based interviewing.
•	Regularly tracking pipeline activity to share with the team and internal stakeholders. Responsible for Hiring Conversions, Cost Per Hire, Candidate Experience and maintaining other Recruitment Metrics such as TAT- Closing hiring requirements in the stipulated turnaround time (Avg TAT maintained of <30 Days YTD), Offer to Joiner ratio- Closely follow on offers to maintain a high Offer to Joiner ratio. 
•	Talent sourcing skills with ability to deep dive into search strategies and execute extensive market specific talent mapping.
•	Strong problem-solving, data analytics and reporting skills.
•	Ensure selected candidates fits the company culture and are in line with the competencies required for the job.

Cvent, Inc. (NYSE: CVT) is a leading cloud-based product development company.

Managed end-to-end recruitment for Web Analytics, Salesforce Developers/ Administrators, Software Sales, Customer Service, Software Developers and Engineers (Java and .Net) 
•	Optimally sourcing and screening candidates, headhunting, market mapping, taking preliminary interviews, selection interviews along with various stakeholders and necessary salary negotiation with candidates before issuing offer and appointment letters. 
•	Recruitment Techniques include database and internet searches, job-postings, referrals, headhunting, sourcing from portals, managing walk-ins and referrals.
•	Consult, influence and manage a diverse range of stakeholders.
•	Developing & maintaining an overall hiring strategy & planning. 
•       Closely follow on offers to maintain a HIGH OFFER TO JOIN RATIO.
•       Cost per hire & budget utilization.
•	Maintaining recruiting data on TALEO and utilising the same for recruiting purposes
•	Maintaining employee records on CRM (SALESFORCE)
•	Take Induction session for all new hires.

•	Responsible for process improvement projects and initiatives within the talent acquisition team.

general.headline: LinkedIn's #1 energy source. I help individuals in their 9-5 jobs create 6-figure #sidehustles. Speaker & Podcaster.
general.description:
👉For coaching, workshops, speaker and press enquiries: ruby@rubylee.co
👉Link to check out my podcast, courses, events + membership site. Copy this into your browser to access all the side hustle goodness: https://linktr.ee/_rubylee_ 

I’m a side hustle coach, entrepreneur and all the energy you need to turn your idea into freedom. 
Here’s a little something about me... I was once nearly fired for having a side hustle, and today I dedicate my life and business to enabling early stage entrepreneurs everywhere to create options in their career and abundance on their own terms, some whilst balancing a day job. 

Side hustlers are the future of work and I am unapologetic for our ambition. From working through your 100 ideas to creating a successful sideline business…. I’ll share my own experiences, practical tips and help you crush through those mindset blockers! 

I am also the co-founder of Tribe9, a platform dedicated to helping funded startups scale up. We partner with founders who have reached a milestone in their lifecycle where they have brought their inspiring ideas to life and are facing a new challenge; growing their tribe. The remit to hire and scale (often quickly and swiftly) can be one time consuming and expensive exercise. Tribe9 hosts a series of workshops to help founders recruit effectively without the overwhelming costs. I'll impart over 10+ years of knowledge and insider recruiter advice to help you build an amazing team. I'll show you how to leverage your brand and hire through the right channels to attract your ideal employees. To work with me check out tribe9.co for workshops, 1:1 founder coaching and consulting. 

Outside of startup land, I'm a mum of 2, wifey to 1, and a tragic almond croissant fan.

Check out: Own Your Hustle group on Facebook or add me to Instagram @_rubylee_

jobs.description:
It can be challenging side hustling and pursuing your dream BUT it’s ultimately worth it. I would know, I’ve been there. In fact, during my career in Recruitment and HR I almost got fired for starting a side-hustle but I didn’t let that stop me. Today I get to work on my bigger purpose, helping start-ups, early-stage entrepreneurs and even employers, hustle.

I know from experience that feeling empowered, motivated and excited for what’s next is what gives you the energy to own your hustle.

That’s why I have made it my full-time gig - coaching, speaking to and mentoring hundreds of amazing individuals to #owntheirhustles and build their businesses.

I believe we get to choose to have it all - whether that’s in our side hustles or in our lives - and that embracing the right attitude, commitment and energy is how we do that. 

Email: ruby@rubylee.co 
Instagram: _rubylee_
Facebook: Own Your Hustle
Podcast: Own Your Hustle

general.headline: Executive Director | Business & Legal Process Outsourcing | Industry Thought Leader | Non-Executive Director
general.description:
A Non Executive Director, Audit Committee Chair, Board Member and Executive Director with over fifteen years of board level experience across the public, commercial & not for profit sectors with particular experience in the information technology, transportation, ports, recruitment and community services industries. 

At board level some highlights include:  Non Executive Director and Audit Committee Chair with the Stars Foundation, Infoxchange, Australian Centre for Grief and Bereavement and Child Australia. In these roles I contribute to strategic planning, financial oversight, corporate governance and compliance. 

In an executive capacity I am the Executive Director of the Strategic Business Alliance, where I manage the strategy and compliance functions for this growing company.  From a startup in 2010, SBA has doubled it’s revenue each year and is currently in the 7th year of it’s operations with currently a national footprint of clients across Australia and New Zealand. Prior to this I was the Chief Financial Officer with Total Staffing Solutions where I led a successful cash flow stabilisation program, including negotiating an increase to the company’s debtor finance facility. Earlier, I was the Commercial Manager with the Extra Group and the Chief Financial Officer with the Geraldton Port Authority where I led the development of the business case for the Berth 5 Iron Ore Expansion Project worth $47M. 

Finally, I have a Master of Accounting, am a Member of the CPA and the Australian Institute of Company Directors.

general.headline: CEO, Founder, Advisory Board Member,
general.description:
Over 15 years of commercial accounting, public accounting and taxation experience specializing in accounting and taxation advice and consulting to Corporations, High Net Wealth Individuals and SME businesses.

Ng is an entrepreneur, cryptocurrency investor and financial strategist with more than 15 years’ experience in commercial and public accounting, IT and taxation services for corporations, high-net-wealth individuals and SMEs.

He is the founder and CEO of First Accountants, a CPA practice with locations across Melbourne, Australia. The firm specializes in business and corporate advisory services, the buying and selling of commercial enterprises, and educational and taxation services. He has overseen the growth of many start-ups.  

A Licensed Tax Agent and member of CPA Australia, Ng began his career as an accountant at Smarts Home Finance in 2001 and has held numerous roles since, including founder and general manager of Australian Education Connections, senior consultant at SalmonGiles/Davidsons and finance and IT manager for ResolutionsRTK.

He migrated to Australia in 1996 and has a passion for helping others, sponsoring his first child through World Vision in 1999. He has since sponsored a dozen more through the Salvation Army and plans to leverage the success and revenue from Nauticus global blockchain businesses to help improve living standards in the developing world.  

Specialties: Taxation Services, Business Advisory, Audit Services, Corporate Advisory, Business Buying and Selling Advisory and Educational services.

jobs.description:
Nauticus is a Melbourne based fintech company that provides user-friendly and secure crypto banking and eCommerce solutions utilizing blockchain technology, underpinned by the Nauticus Coin. 

The Nauticus crypto and fiat currency exchange is in development and due to open in mid-2018. It will trade at 100 cryptocurrencies at launch, and more than 300 within 12 months – including Bitcoin, Ethereum, Ripple and many others. Nauticus Coin users will receive 50 percent discount on trading fees in the first year which will spur adoption of the coin and support its value. The exchange will also incorporate payment processing. 

Nauticus will also establish a sustainable, large-scale blockchain mining center in 2019 to provide revenue, along with sizeable server capacity to ensure ultrafast processing for users of Nauticus services. Profits from the exchange and mine will be reinvested in the business to support the subsequent development of a low-cost eCommerce platform, along with merchant and peer to peer payment options and other banking services. The company will also develop a 'one and done' Know Your Customer (KYC) verification service and create an Initial Coin Offering community providing a range of resources and services for new ICOs along with a quality verification system.

First Accountants Pty Ltd is CPA practice located in Kew and Essendon of Victoria, Australia.  The Principal, a CPA, has been providing accounting and taxation services to SME and large businesses, for over 15 years.
Our vision is to provide professional holistic accounting and financial services to every client, large or small, in a friendly, personalised and approachable manner. We aim to provide tailored, quality and cost competitive One Stop Shop financial solution for our clients and their businesses to grow and succeed. This is guaranteed through our tailored solutions, quality services and cost competitive advice, where we work closely with our clients to become their long-term trusted accountant and business advisor.

general.headline: Executive Chairman at WBP Group, Director at Property Duo , Judge on Nine Network's The Block. Keynote Speaker.
general.description:
Educating consumers and investors on the Australian property market is vital to the health of our industry.

As an expert in the Australian property market, international keynote speaker and Executive Chairman of WBP Group and Director of Property Duo , I am a passionate advocate for the role property plays in developing personal wealth.

With more than 25 years’ experience working in valuations and buyers advocacy, I’ve seen a multitude of changes in the property and financial services industries, many of which have added to the complexity of selecting property for investment.

If you would like to chat about speaking or business opportunities, feel free to send me an InMail.

jobs.description:
My responsibilities include coordinating a team of almost 300 highly skilled and certified property professionals in the delivery of objective and impartial property valuations and advice for all types of Australian commercial, residential and specialised properties. I advise on property risk management issues, determining valuer for dispute resolution and how to make smart property investment decisions.

In my role I am regularly called upon by the media and other industry bodies for comment and opinion regarding the property investment and valuation industries. 

Specialties: Investment property selection, residential property investing,residential and commercial valuations and predicting property market movements

WBP Group is Australia’s only independently owned and operated property advisory, valuations and management company.

Established in 1992, WBP Group is a leading provider of residential and commercial property services in Australia. WBP Group's clients include professionals and everyday people alike, seeking property investment advice, property valuations and commercial property management, along with Australia’s largest banks and lenders who utilise our professional and precise valuations service.

Our services include the below areas of excellence:
Property Valuations
Property Investment Advisory
Buyer Advisory
Vendor Advisory
Property Portfolio Review

In 2015, I joined the newly appointed Buyers Jury panel on the 10th season of Network Nine's The Block. Dubbed Triple Threat, the season gave host to a number of changes including a panel of buyer's advocates who's purpose was to provide feedback to contestants from a buyer's perspective.

The transition to national television has been a challenging and rewarding experience, providing insights into the world of television production and introducing me to some of Australia's most influential personalities and business people.

One of my key responsibilities as a senior valuer and property strategist in the Westpac Property Risk team was to advise its merchant bankers on strategies for distressed asset portfolios. In this role I worked closely with receiver management, loan management and the recoveries team. 

I also provided commercial property and valuation advice to Westpac’s credit team, commercial managers and bank managers throughout Victoria. I have been exposed to a wide range of properties from high end prestige residential, shopping centres, industrial premises, hotels and motels, specialised properties and rural holdings

Westpac Banking Corporation is a multinational financial-services provider, one of the Australian "big four" banks and the second-largest bank in New Zealand.

As of November 2011, Westpac has 12.2 million customers, Australia's largest branch network with almost 1200 branches and a network with more than 2900 ATMs. The bank is Australia's second-largest provider of home lending and Australia's second-largest provider of wealth platforms by funds under administration. The bank is Australia's largest business-banking lender and Australia's second-largest bank by assets.

general.headline: Music School Success Coach, Music School Owner, Music Teacher & Examiner,Teacher Trainer, Author, Speaker & Adjudicator.
general.description:
"Making music gives me a connection with my heart and soul. Music is pure joy."

Do you have a music school and want to figure out how to Grow from a Solo Operation to a Music School with Teachers that work for you and help you?

Do you want to be taken more seriously by your students or your student's parents? 

Do you want the secret to finding and keeping reliable teachers?

Well, you are in the right place. Over the last 40 years, I've built up my music school from the ground up and worked with thousands of students. I currently have 25 teachers working for me in my music school and I've experienced first hand the ups and downs of the music school business.

Over the years, I've been asked countless times about how I have done it, so I decided to put my secrets in my ebook, "Secrets of a Profitable Music School".

>>> You can grab your copy at http://www.wendysmusic.com.au/free-e-book/<<<<<

As a young teacher I saw many people wanting to make music but being frustrated getting started and ultimately giving up their dream. I have dedicated many years to creating a simple way to learn to make music and showing others how to teach  in this way.

It would be a great privilege to show you how simple it can be to learn to make music and to help you on your musical journey.

It is also a privilege to assist other teachers and educators to achieve their goals of making their Music School a Success.

Wendy’s Music School and my Music School Success programs were born from my desire to enable everyone to  experience the pure joy that making music can bring to their life. Music can change lives.

Specialties: Developing music programs, music education author,  Music Teacher Trainer, Music examiner, Music Adjudicator, Speaker, Music School Franchise, Business start up and development.

>>>>Grab your copy of my FREE book here: http://www.wendysmusic.com.au/free-e-book/<<<<<

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer at ANZ
general.description:
I’m an international banker with more than 25 years working in Asia, Europe, the Middle East, the Americas and the Pacific.

Since 1 January 2016, I have been ANZ’s Chief Executive Officer.  Prior to that, I was Chief Financial Officer accountable for all aspects of Finance as well as Group Strategy, Legal, Treasury, Investor Relations, and Mergers and Acquisitions.

I joined ANZ in 2009 as CEO Institutional, leading ANZ’s Transaction Banking, Global Markets, Global Loans and relationship Banking. Prior to ANZ I worked for EFG-Hermes, Citibank/Citigroup across multiple countries.

After 25 years of working in some very different countries for some very different customers I continue to enjoy experiencing different cultures. I’m also an avid pursuer of diverse ideas to inform my thinking and a big believer that we should favour simplicity over complexity in both life and work.

You can follow me on Twitter, Facebook and read my articles on ANZ BlueNotes - www.bluenotes.anz.com

Global Managing Director Institutional Banking responsible for providing services to
      ANZ's Institutional customers across 32 countries in particular through three major
      product platforms: Global Markets, Transaction Banking and Global Loans. Member of
      
      the Group Management Board.

Based in Cairo, EFG-Hermes was at the time the largest investment bank in the Middle East and the #1 retail and institutional broker in Cairo, Dubai and Abu Dhabi in addition to brokerage operations in most Arab and North African markets. The firm managed over $6bn in a range of equity, money market and private equity funds and was the regional leader in IPO and M&A advisory services. The COO role includes Technology, Risk Management, Compliance, Audit, Human Resources, Management Reporting, Legal, Investor Relations, Public Relations and Marketing.

Global Transaction Banking is a core element of Citigroup's strategy globally and services a large number of Institutional and Corporate customers across the region in the areas of cash management, trade finance and custody. The CEO is responsible for the business across the entire region from Japan and China down to Australia and from India and Bangladesh across to New Zealand and all countries in between.

general.description:
Sam is the founder and CEO of Blockchain Global Limited , a profitable technology company with audited FY2016 revenue of AU$5.9 million, and offices in Melbourne, Hong Kong, Dalian and Washington. The company's corporate accelerator program has made over a dozen investments in successful startups leveraging Blockchain Technology. 

With Blockchain Technology poised to dis-intermediate middlemen on a global scale, Sam established the Distributed Group, a blockchain venture platform that connects corporates, investors and entrepreneurs through a network of +100 DLT pioneers that apply knowledge to create value at all stages, (Ideation, Proof of Concept and Production), with the aim to ultimately reduced friction, fraud and cost for any company in any industry that interfaces with technology.

As an industry leader, Sam founded the Blockchain Centre , (worlds first Blockchain Knowledge Hub) and Distributed Technologies Institute . He is a frequent speaker, having delivered presentations as a subject matter expert at numerous Blockchain Summits, DLT Conferences and Governance Institute Forums among others and been interviewed on CNBC, BBC, Sky News and RT.

general.headline: Blogger, Speaker, Author, Podcaster and Online Entrepreneur
general.description:
Blogging was a medium that I stumbled upon by accident in 2002 after following a link in an email from a friend. Little did I know that just 18 months later I'd be one of the world's first professional bloggers and making a living from blogging.

Out of writing a personal blog that covered everything from politics, to religion, to cultural observations I launched Digital Photography Blog in 2003. This quickly grew in both readership and I began to experiment with making a little money from it to pay its server costs. In time it grew into a part time job and then into my full time focus.

Today I work on two blogs - Problogger.net, Digital-Photography-School.com which are read by around 5 million visitors per month.

As someone with no background in tech or web development I'm constantly amazed at the journey I've been on since 2002 and have a passion for helping others on that same path. 

While I've been at this for a while I'm no expert and am certainly not the biggest blogger going around. I'm just one of millions of normal people around the world using tools like blogging and social media to make a living online.

Previously I co-founded numerous businesses including 'Third Tribe Marketing' and 'b5media blog network'. I've also had the privilege to co-author a paper book 'ProBlogger: Secrets for Blogging Your Way to a Six Figure Income' (Wiley) and founded the ProBlogger Training Event in Australia - attended annually by over 550 Australian bloggers.

I love to speak at conferences and events on the topic of blogging, social media, building a personal brand, entrepreneurship (and more) and am more than open to be approached from media for comment on such topics. Learn more about booking me as a speaker for your next event at http://www.problogger.net/speaking/

If we're not connected already on LinkedIn feel free to hit the connect button here on my profile and use the email address darren@problogger.net

I look forward to connecting with you!

general.headline: B2B Sales Leader | Best-Selling Author | Key-Note Speaker | Social Selling | HubSpot Ambassador & Guest Blogger
general.description:
Businesses have 2 challenges: sales, and everything else. 

I firmly believe that 'sales' is the most important function in every business, and I have spent almost 3 decades helping my employers (and clients) drive sustainable revenue growth. 

However, B2B sales is now changing at an accelerated pace due to the massive change that we are witnessing in buyer behavior. Product life-cycles are getting shorter, sales cycles are getting longer, there are more competitors entering every market, and buyers are doing most of their research online before they call you. Many sales people are now struggling to even get a meeting with a buyer, let alone sell them something new. 

I have spent the past 4 years researching and studying all of this change, and I have written an international best-selling book called - The Future of the Sales Profession. Through my business (SalesTribe) I now help sales people and business leaders to transform in order to create opportunity amid all of this change. 

I have worked in the UK, Australia and across Asia Pacific as a representative of some of the world’s most innovative IT, telecommunications, finance and media organisations, and I have an MBA (Exec) (Distinction) from RMIT. I'm also a part-time lecturer and student mentor in the RMIT Executive MBA Program.

Today, I'm the Founder and CEO of SalesTribe, the world’s first career transition management company designed specifically to help SMB's accelerate sales growth, whilst simultaneously assisting B2B sales people whom require new career opportunities.

jobs.description:
SalesTribe is a two-sided global marketplace that connects small-medium businesses (SMB’s) with professional sales capability. 

SalesTribe is the world’s first service that caters specifically to B2B sales people, many of whom are now grappling with the enormous change that is impacting their careers – change that is being brought about by advancing technology that enables buyer self-service, and the rise and rise of the 'on-demand' economy. 

SalesTribe not only assists B2B sales people to navigate their way through all of this change, but also connects sales people into exciting new career paths. Leveraging the 'network effects' of being part of a global community, SalesTribe helps to identify new and exciting job opportunities for our members, such as working in the burgeoning "start-up" space, where sales capability is now in high demand. 

Start-ups and SMB's urgently need sales acceleration and best practices. Sales people now require a new way to find exciting new career opportunities. SalesTribe makes those connections.

Register today at www.salestribe.com

Transform Sales International offers are range of services spanning specialist consultancy, sales optimisation, performance improvement, sales coaching & mentoring, and transformational change programs.

www.transformsales.com.au

My latest book (The Future of the Sales Profession) has just achieved International Best Seller (Amazon) status in 4 countries across 25 categories. 

Description: B2B sales is harder than ever before. Product life-cycles are getting shorter, sales cycles are getting longer, there are more competitors entering the market, and buyers are doing most of their research online before they even call you. When you finally get the meeting, buyers only want your best price.
Despite all of this, your manager keeps asking for more – more calls, more meetings, more pipeline, faster, faster, faster!

You’re stuck between a rock and a hard place – a more challenging sales environment than ever before on one side, and ever-increasing quotas and expectations on the other.

How will you respond? Wait and see how it all unfolds? Or fight for your career and your livelihood? 
In The Future of the Sales Profession, I will share with you the cold, hard truths about the new realities facing the sales profession, and how you can protect and enhance your career.

general.headline: Talent Acqusition Partner at Timberlink Australia I New Zealand
general.description:
My background began in the construction and industrial industries, having spent over 7 years recruiting within these sectors.

Having spent over 11 years within the external recruitment sector, I am now transitioning these skills into internal recruitment with Timberlink Australia, dedicated to finding the very best staff across Australia and New Zealand.

jobs.description:
Every day at Timberlink we transform sustainably grown plantation pine into quality timber products. Our products can be used to make almost anything from a simple pallet to an 8-storey building. 

And the best thing? Every cubic metre we make has removed 631kg of CO2 from the atmosphere. 

This is why timber has a critical role to play in sustainable construction and manufacturing in Australia. It drives us to ​continually invest in our sawmills, upgrading and installing cutting edge technology so that we can efficiently produce the quality our customers expect.

Our focus is on structural timber for wall frames and roof trusses like our termite resistant Timberlink Blue and our outdoor structural Timberlink Green with the latest enhancement of Low Odour for decks and pergolas. We also make super straight Timberlink Arrow Posts, Timberlink Decking, fencing, sleepers, appearance DAR lining boards, mouldings and woodchips. By cutting a range of products from each log we ensure that we can efficiently supply products for many different uses.

Our three regional sawmills, in Tarpeena, Bell Bay and Blenheim, are supported by our national distribution network. This gives our customers flexibility and fast turnarounds supported by an experienced sales and service team. At Timberlink we are committed to our key values of safety first, openness, fairness, resilience, respect, and integrity. 

We think that what we have is unique in our industry. With a secure access to sustainably grown plantation logs and committed long term shareholders, we are big enough to be relevant, yet small enough to know our customers.

Our most important responsibility is returning our employees home safely. Every day.

Founded in 1996, Conquest Personnel has grown to be one of the leading recruitment companies within the Australian market.

general.headline: Senior Business Leader at GTRS- Providing Recruitment, Internship, Migration, and other Personnel Services
general.description:
With over 20 years of collective experience in the industry, GTRS provides individuals and businesses in Australia with comprehensive staffing solutions. GTRS can assist you with Internships, Permanent, Temporary and Contract Staffing Placements, Migration Processing, Employee Training and other Human Resource requirements. We have already helped over 20,000 individuals find the ideal placement with Australia’s leading business organizations.

My key strengths include the ability to provide strong leadership based on sound business experience as well as having an astute understanding of new market trends and how to adapt them to fit a growing business. I leverage these traits when analyzing an organisation's staffing requirements and making recommendations for internships and all types of employee placements.

I am an entrepreneur with a strong background in business development and marketing. I am passionate about employment practices and matching the right candidate with the right organisation and position, based on their experience and skill sets and the company's staffing needs.

I have assembled a staff of Human Resource professionals who share my expertise and passion. The GTRS team works hard to prepare and place interns and job candidates so that both they and the employer benefit from the match. Our staff is expert in migration issues, professional training and post-placement management for the people they work with.

jobs.description:
Working with Australia's top Business, Educational and Non-Profit Organizations to assist them with their staffing needs. Providing services including Internships, Permanent, Temporary and Contract Staffing. Employee Training, Resolution of Migration issues and IELTS/PTE test preparation.

* Work with Employers to identify and analyze their staffing requirements.
* Recruit, train and manage the GTRS staff. Empower these Human Resource Professionals to work with individuals and organisations to match the right candidate or intern with the appropriate employer and position.
* Develop and implement training and placement programs withing the GTRS operating framework.
* Create a long-term strategy and operating plan to ensure that GTRS will continue to be one of Australia's premier staffing agencies.

As the Sales and Marketing Manager, my role was to grow the business by bringing in new ideas and then implementing them as well as working closely with the other departments withing the company. I was also actively involved in the promotion of the business and acquisition of new clients. Other duties included staff management, hiring, coaching, and mentoring. I focused on making sure the business provided a great working environment for our staff to learn and grow. In addition to this, I was also in charge of: 

•	Developing new procedures and policies for the company
•	Searching for talented people to join the organization
•	Working with IT to build sophisticated systems to manage the business
•	Constantly finding new ways to grow and move the business forward

general.headline: Learning and Development Manager
general.description: I’m a learning professional who is actively engaged and intellectually curious about the learning & training industry. I work closely with SMEs on a daily basis to create compelling training programs both for online and face to face delivery using educational design frameworks. I’ve managed teams within various client facing industries, and I’m now a confident leader who completes projects using an agile approach, on time and within budget. I work well under pressure and have great organisational and planning skills to match.

jobs.description:
I provide consultant and development services such as audio engineering, graphic design, developing eLearning modules, course curation, video-editing, animations, storyboarding and script writing. My tasks include:
- Collaborating with stakeholders and subject matter experts (SMEs) to understand business needs and translate them into learning and performance objectives, facilitate approvals and gain alignment on content direction, design and details
- Work on project teams and as an individual to complete projects 
- Identify the need within a clients brief and determine a solution by evaluating, implementing and managing educational technology and tools 
- Use a wide range of Learning Management Systems to deploy various training resources
- Assess training needs through surveys, interviews with employees, or consultations with managers or trainers
- Deliver training to employees using a variety of instructional techniques
- Monitor and evaluate training programs to ensure they are current and effective, and apply changes as needed
- Perform administrative tasks such as monitoring costs, scheduling classes, setting up systems and equipment, and coordinating enrollment
- Evaluate training performance and take actions to improve processes
- Working with team members, partners, and key stakeholders to define project scope(s)
- Developing project plans including planning and scheduling project timelines
- Tracking project deliverables to ensure quality, on-time completion of project(s)
- Monitoring and reporting on progress of project(s) to stakeholders
- Identifying risks and working with team members to identify solutions to mitigate those risks to keep project(s) on track
- Reviewing best practices and trends related to L&D and our audience

I set the benchmark for the development of eLearning and face to face resources for sale and distribution. My tasks include:

- Execute and take full responsibility of the L&D life-cycle including project design, management of needs analysis, content development and facilitation/roll-out　

- Lead a team of designers to analyse, design, develop and manage over 150 courses (Unit of competency)

- Set and work production timelines and perform instructional design tasks using the ADDIE principle

- Develop eLearning content and print-based materials 

- Conduct content validation in liaison with internal and external stakeholders 

- Identify and incorporate the most effective and innovative practices in learning delivery including social and peer learning, game-based learning, informal learning, and performance support.

- Apply best practices in adult learning to design, write, and build a range of high-quality learning experiences, with an emphasis on e-learning, video, animations, serious games, and gamification

- Seek out new learning solutions and bring innovative ideas to team projects and the company at large

- Update and maintain existing content on an ongoing basis

- Curate existing content into new learning designs and paths

- Upload learning solutions into theLMS and test complete solution in target environments 

- Attend appropriate conferences and seminars to maintain an up-to-date knowledge base of new instructional software and pedagogical techniques

- Work closely with product and channel marketing to leverage all sales opportunities

- Work with partner account managers to ensure successful delivery of product training needs for key customers

We create visually engaging resume templates that increases the chances of employers spending more than just a few seconds glancing over your resume, and allows you to put your best foot forward. We exist to simply help you land that interview and the job you deserve, and hopefully spread the word about graphical resumes!

I designed, developed, implemented and supported training resources for numerous universities based on client briefs and research. By using an AGILE approach I create engaging learning activities and compelling course content that enhances retention and knowledge transfer. My tasks include:
- Conduct instructional research and analysis on learners and contexts
- Work with subject matter experts (SME's) and identify target audiences training needs, state instructional end goals and create content that matches them
- Create instructional graphics, the user interface and the finished product of various training materials 
- Apply tested pedagogy and instructional design theories, practice and methods to design, create and manage a range of high quality training materials
- Creatively take technical content and be able to present and create fluent and innovative learning materials
- Maintained project documentation and course folders
- Stay current and relevant in educational technology, adult learning, educational best practices

I designed and developed curriculum material for student courses in a manner which enhances student’s engagement and participation. By using a variety of software (including video, audio, animation and authoring tools) I created captivating content. My tasks include:
- Design, develop and deploy learning content based on business needs
- Develop various courses for traditional classroom, virtual classroom, and web-based training media
- Participate in the needs assessment, design and development of product and role specific curriculum road maps incorporating high-level designs
- Interact with SMEs in planning and scoping requirements for training resources
- Function on Learning and Development team as well as independently in design, development and testing of instructional materials
- Review and test revised curriculum offerings from other team members, providing feedback and suggestions for improvement
- Develop course descriptions and related course-specific marketing documents and tools in liaison with the marketing department
- Work closely with internal employees to implement and maintain programs
- Provide reporting to management of training progression and completion, student usage, and instructor-led training completions
- Attend appropriate conferences and seminars to maintain an up-to-date knowledge base of new instructional software and pedagogical techniques.
- Identify and assess future and current training needs and gaps
- Upload training solutions to the LMS and test in specific environments

Responsible for all passenger movements between the terminal and aircraft.  Process travel documents, assign boarding passes and perform many of the behind the scenes processes that are required for airline operations.

Operate the check-in counters and prepare boarding passes and baggage reclaim vouchers.  In addition, it is these helpful and courteous staff who perform passenger boarding functions and other critical functions such as preparing load and trim documents that ensure that the aircraft is balanced correctly for flight.

Ensure that every passenger is treated with the utmost respect and courtesy and an ever present smile.  This challenging role is diverse and exciting and is the happy face of Aero-Care and our partners. 

Load and unload aircraft, perform aircraft cleaning, service aircraft water and lavatory systems and drive airport equipment on the ramp.

When a person checks in at the airport, their luggage is placed on a moving bag belt which is transferred to the bag room for sorting and allocation to the correct flight.  This is the realm of the ramp service agent.

Marshal the aircraft onto the parking bay and position all ground support equipment (GSE) and guide passengers into the terminal.  It is then required to unload the aircraft of passenger baggage and freight and transfer it to the terminal for passenger pickup.  Prior to passengers boarding the aircraft for its next flight sector, ramp service agents may clean the aircraft cabin and service the aircraft potable water and lavatory systems.  When all baggage checks are complete, baggage handlers will then load the aircraft holds with the passenger baggage, and any additional freight, before marshaling or pushing the aircraft onto the taxi way using a specialised push back tractor.

Airport safety and security, as such all employees must be eligible to hold an Aviation Security Identification Card (ASIC).

People – Following basic people essentials, Understanding Procedures, Promoting Teamwork, Assisting Others, Following instruction.

Quality, Service, Cleanliness (QSC) – Following critical standards for raw and finished product quality, Delivering fast and friendly service, adhering to performance standards, supporting promotions, maintain operation kitchen areas to exceed customer cleanliness.

Food Safety/Sanitation/Hygiene – Following all food safety, sanitation and hygiene requirements and practices.

Customer Engagement – Ensure excellent customer service is provided

Workplace Safety – Use hazard log to identify and assess hazards, report workplace safety matters, follow correct PPE procedures, look out for others.

Business Results – Being aware of the goals and targets of the restaurant.

jobs.description:
Ostara Australia is a national not-for-profit organisation that works closely with the Australian Government, member organisations, communities and employers to place people disadvantaged through age, health, disability or cultural background into sustainable employment.

Our holistic approach is to address both the vocational and non-vocational barriers faced by disadvantaged job seekers. As such, we deliver personalised employment services, whilst also working in collaboration with countless community and welfare organisations to help job seekers with any mental, cultural or emotional challenges.

NES Global Talent is a leading global recruitment specialist that focuses on permanent, interim, retained or project solutions within the IT arena.

We represent a wealth of IT experts around the world, with experience of working in oil and gas, FMCG, life sciences and energy companies. We will always strive to find you the best talent.

Some of the key disciplines we represent are:

PMO/ IT programme and Project management
Business systems and Data analysis
Telecoms/Networking infrastructure and security
IT operations, architecture & support
Software and systems testers
Databases (CRM and ERP) and Development (including .NET, Java, C# and C++)

Established in 1978, NES Global Talent is an award winning manpower specialist that has placed over 70 different nationalities into 69 countries across the Oil and Gas, Power, Construction and Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Manufacturing and IT sectors worldwide. We provide guaranteed staffing solutions, sourced from a global talent pool by a dedicated, discipline specific team of over 500 consultants.

It’s people that deliver projects and with over 45 offices in 28 countries across Europe, Africa, the Americas, Asia, Australia and the Middle East, we have access to the best talent wherever it may be in the world. NES Global Talent can offer a full range of staffing solutions: Contract, Permanent (Direct) Hire, Managed Solutions, contingency and project-based, or a fully outsourced service. These services are complemented by an industry leading support service and mobility package to ensure clients keep hold of the top talent in a compliant manner for as long as they need it.

For more information visit: http://www.nesglobaltalent.com

Worked with with MBA (Michael Bailey Associates) Oil and Gas Asia Pac who had Oil and Gas divisions in both Malaysia and Singapore, I was a Senior Consultant- Engineering for the Malaysian office. 

As one of the key locations for the global Oil and Gas industry, Malaysia is a prime location for companies targeting highly skilled experts across the country. Our team of experienced consultants provide project based solutions and consultancy services to leading clients. 

At MBA Oil and Gas we are able to deal with complex projects and we are able to provide a full suite of services to ensure successful outcomes for each of our clients. 

Between our Malaysian and Singaporean operations we have a strong track record of delivering solutions for some of the biggest global Oil and Gas companies. Through our expert knowledge and industry expertise we have comprehensive networks of high quality talent and a strong understanding of market trends specific to the region. 

One of the biggest challenges facing the Oil and Gas industry right now is attracting new talent as the next generation of engineers drives the industry forward, and the demand for highly experienced talent working on upstream and downstream projects has never been higher. More and more clients are choosing to partner with us based on our strengths and qualities in the local market.

general.headline: Chief Executive Officer
general.description:
As Australian Red Cross CEO, I am responsible for leading the organisation to achieve its purpose.  That is, supporting and empowering people and communities in times of vulnerability, preventing and alleviating suffering across Australia and internationally through mobilising the power of humanity 

Prior to joining Red Cross, I was global Chief Operating Officer for WWF (World Wide Fund for Nature). Other roles have included Chief Executive Officer of Lonely Planet Publications and Chief of Consumer Sales at Telstra. Have also worked with a Silicon Valley start-up helping them launch in Australia. general.description:
I have dedicated my career to working in the health care system. My educational background in nursing, midwifery and public health has provided me with a deep understand of the health care system in Australia. I am enthusiastic about the ongoing development of health care system improvements within Australia, with particular emphasis on public health. During my professional career I have worked in the public hospital system in both Victoria and Tasmania. I have also worked more recently in the community health sector in Victoria. My most recent work experience was working on projects in Mental Health care, the Aged Care sector and as a registered nurse case manager in the hospital admission risk program in the Eastern Region. I also have recently developed an interest in disability and have spent a significant amount of time learning about the significant changes occurring with the introduction and progress of NDIS. My directorship at Link Health And Community combines my professional skills and passion for fairness and equity in health for our community.

I am at the editing stage of my first book. This is so exciting for me. I am also developing a new program entitled Community Healthcare Coaching. It uses the same perspective as an executive coach. I provide a coach to support people through the health and welfare sector during a period in their life that requires a sensitive and supporting ear. As a coach we would not replace clinical programs but support the successful transition across the system as a patient requires. Answering questions and supporting communication between services and between the patient (or their Carer) and the health professionals caring for them.

general.headline: National Indigenous Specialist at Downer
general.description:
I have been working in Aboriginal employment, training & mentoring for 21 years with the majority of my career across the top end of the Northern Territory and last 5 years in Melbourne.  I have grown up with Aboriginal culture throughout my childhood in regional Darwin and chose this career path when I was young, as I  knew it would always be a passion driven career.  My children are Traditional Owners to their country in Coburg, Arnhem Land  and stay very connected to country and their culture by flying back to Darwin and going bush with family for 4 weeks every year.  

I do what I do for my grandchildren to come and their grandchildren, in breaking down barriers around Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander employment, by empowering people to be their best in representing themselves, their families and their community.  

My focus is to assist and educate the corporate arena in providing employment and training opportunities to the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander community by utilising my experience, knowledge and acquired skills.  

I consider myself to be a mover and a shaker and represent community & employers in the best light to each other.  I'll never stop learning and I'll never stop teaching.

jobs.companyName: Girls Academy - Role Models and Leaders Australia
jobs.description:
The Advisory Board provides support and strategic advice to the Board of Role Model and Leaders Australia (RMLA) for the flagship
program, Girls Academy.
Background
RMLA is a not-for-profit charitable organisation founded in 2004 by Australian basketball legend and Olympian Ricky Grace after he identified an urgent unmet need for support programs tailored for secondary school aged Indigenous girls. The Girls Academy addresses the inequity in investment in educational support programs for Indigenous girls by working within local school systems to support girls to engage in education and pursue their goals though mentoring, sport, cultural and empowerment programs.

The role and objectives of the Advisory Board include:
*Support the Girls Academy program
*Provide strategic advice to the RMLA Board in relation to:
* Building the profile of the Girls Academy Program
* Raising of awareness of the Girls Academy Program
* Raising of funds for the Girls Academy Program
* Engage with partners and supporters, potential partners/supporters, and local communities of the Girls Academy
* Attend (in person or via teleconference) Advisory Board meetings and other Girls Academy functions as appropriate.

The Melbourne Chatterbox operates five nights a week in Melbourne's CBD and inner suburbs.  The service is manned by a team of volunteers headed up by Open Family Australia's Volunteer Coordinator and The Chatterbox Volunteer Committee.  The service has been operational in Melbourne since 2002 and is proudly supported by Cabrini Health and PFD Foods.

The Chatterbox provides a variety of services to street frequenting young people, linking them to the services they require as well as providing basic material aid in food, clothing and health supplies.  There is also wireless internet facilities, computers and a separate space to enable volunteers to quietly counsel and engage with young people.  Many of the young people are attracted to the Melbourne CBD as it is a focal point for entertainment and a means to escape their problems.  Problems include family breakdown, unemployment, drug and alcohol use and abuse.  Young people may be involved in commercial sex work, struggling with drug issues, sleeping rough and/or in constant need of food or material aid.

A.R.T. Employment (Aboriginal Recruitment Training and Employment)  is an Aboriginal owned and managed company, established to develop and implement innovative and unique Aboriginal training and employment models of national significance. RAW Recruitment is an Indigenous Labour Hire model designed to service the local Koorie Community across all industries throughout Victoria.

 Our Mission as a company is to deliver culturally inclusive and competent training and employment models that embeds "wrap around services" for Aboriginal job seekers and employers of Aboriginal people. Our Aim as a company is to ensure economic participation for all Aboriginal job seekers, and for many, this first experience is both a rewarding and a successful experience. Our Service specialises in the delivery of Corporate Competencies and Mentoring/Coaching for Aboriginal jobseekers.

I come to my role with 20 years experience around Indigenous employment and training.  This is my area of passion and an area I work hard towards, with educating employers around cultural awareness in the workplace before opening doors and creating employment opportunities.  My main objective always lies around retention and ensuring our candidates are in their roles for the length of a career and not a just a job.  

We use many retention tools, with mentoring being one of our most effective.  All of our services are free of charge to both employers and candidates.  We have a number of highly experienced mentors and Indigenous Recruitment Consultants on hand to answer any of your questions.   
To find out more about our programs and services – please contact our office on 03 9662 3388 or feel free to email me: moana@rawrecruitment.com.au

general.headline: The Joshua Group & Melanie Dyer

jobs.description:
At just 23, the Sydney-based singer-songwriter bursts onto the scene with startling vibrancy. The album’s lead single ‘Fresh’ is an established No. 1 hit, occupying the top spot on the official Australian Country Airplay Chart for five consecutive weeks, while Melanie herself recently performed for capacity crowds alongside Aussie country-pop powerhouse the McClymonts on the NSW leg of their mammoth Endless Tour 2017.

That Fresh should arrive glistening with the kind of polish and perfection that is usually reserved for the work of a veteran recording artist is no accident. Growing up on a farm at Mount Russell, NSW listening to Patsy Cline, Dolly Parton and Shania Twain, Melanie picked up a guitar for the first time at the tender age of 11. The rest is history – and the result of years of dedication and hard work. “I wrote my first song when I was 12, which was called ‘Life on the Land’,” Melanie recalls. “It became the anthem for Woolworths’ National Drought Appeal in 2007. It was really special to me, because I grew up on a farm, my dad’s a farmer, and I’m a country kid.”

At just 12 years of age, Melanie made her solo stage debut in the monumental NSW Schools Spectacular. The ensuing years saw Melanie graduate from the CMAA’s Camerata Programme twice, enter the coveted NSW Talent Development Project, before attending the famed CMAA Academy of Country Music. A 3-time Australian Song Writing Association Competition finalist, in 2011, Melanie was invited by the NSW Department of Education to compose the theme song for Education Week. From there, Melanie’s signing to Universal Music Australia in 2013 was a natural step forward.

In 2010 our Founder and Director, Joshua Di Girolamo, designed the first logo for a local dog and cat groomer. Fast forward to today and The Joshua Group has quickly become a leading creative, marketing and digital agency, passionate about your brand and driving sales to your business.

We believe in order to service your brand with the highest care and integrity - we have to live it, speak it, breathe it and LOVE it!

With these values, our clients (like you) receive an experience and outcome that is relatable and professional for your brand.

We do what we love and we love what we do, and hope that one day we are able to create for you, The Joshua Group experience.

general.headline: Talent Acquisition Specialist at Object Consulting
general.description:
As a Delivery Manager specializing in the placement of Digital professionals, I am passionate about connecting top Digital talent with exciting IT opportunities at the most innovative companies across APAC. 

As a former Developer, I have an in-depth understanding of both sides of recruitment: candidate and client, enabling me to source and qualify skills with precision. 

If you work in Digital and are looking for a new job opportunity then I am your go-to person! I’ve always been a people person and I enjoy helping people discover and nurture their talents within the Digital sector. There’s nothing like the thrill of a candidate’s enthusiastic “Yes!” to an offer, and an equally pleased hiring manager who just landed a top performer. Perhaps even more satisfying is successfully recruiting a superstar and then seeing them develop a million-dollar product. Knowing my efforts impact the bottom energises me every day.

If I’m not recruiting I’m probably reading a good book, hiking the foothills, or binge-watching the latest Netflix sensation.

general.headline: I Help Employers Save Considerable Amount of WorkCover Premiums And Put It Back As Company Profits
general.description:
Yon is a sought after Australian Workers Compensation expert.

Yon  had worked with Allianz Australia, a WorkCover Scheme Agent & also had worked with blue chip corporations such as ANZ, GE & various Mercantile agencies. 

Yon's role within the Worker’s Compensation division include Case Managing, Underwriting, Credit Collections  & currently as a Consultant, consulting in Australian Workers Compensation Insurance.

Yon provide advice from Premium to Claims consulting for all States and Territories. Yon has helped many clients in saving considerable  amount of money by reviewing their WorkCover Industry Classification, Wage Auditing by challenging KPMG for refund,  forecasting future premium based on claim costs & affectively managed client's policy to ensure they wouldn't attract penalties & fines. 

In recent years Yon had saved a client just over $500K in premium due to succession being applied. Yon also saved a client more than $80K due to a classification reviewed. Recently Yon saved a labour hire company  in excess of $2M in premiums by reviewing their on-hire labour Industry Classifications. 

Yon can provide clients' strategy & craft  solutions to ensure they get the maximum benefits from their Workers Compensation Insurance policy. Turning their saved premiums into company profits.

Having worked in the financial services & an entrepreneur in hospitality industries, led & been part of a team, Yon understand & value the importance of an effective team & driving high performance. He is a strong negotiator, empathetic listener, result driven & able to quickly build rapport with internal & external customers & key stakeholders. 

Yon always love a challenge & continuous learning for improvement. He is highly motivated who requires no supervision and always passionate in what he does.

Yon enjoy life, funny & never afraid being a fool to put a smile on someone. An out going person & love to meet people.

jobs.description:
Currently a Premium Officer at Insurance House Group providing advice to employers and clients on Workers' Compensation  legislation and related matters. From premium consulting, policy renewals, placements, premium projections and analysis. Workcover Industry Classification reviews and related claims issues and management. 

Proactively building client relationship externally and internally, developing, building rapport and maintaining business services and relationship with all parties for return businesses and referrals.

This role sits within the Workers’ Compensation Premium Division and is responsible for servicing internal and external Brokers, Accountants, large employers and their associates. Duties includes the following: 
-	 Processing of new Workcover applications received and advising relevant parties once policy registered.
-	 Developing, building rapport and maintaining business services and relationship with all parties for return businesses and referrals. 
-	 Providing Premium or Workcover Industry Classification (WIC) quotes. 
-	Ensuring policy Effective Dates, Succession, Grouping and WIC are appropriately considered and supporting evidence/documentation are obtained.
-	Ensuring underwriting decisions are made in line with the Victorian Workcover Authority (VWA) and Allianz policies. Decisions include penalties charges involving late payment, Uninsured Policy Period and Underestimation Penalty charge.
-	Providing accurate and timely advice to all participants in the scheme on underwriting and claims issues. 
-	Assisting in the management of WorkCover policies (including calculating employer premiums, documenting decisions/recommendations for audits and completing certified remuneration forms).
-	Ceasing/reinstating policies and updating/assessing past remunerations. 
-	Ensuring all Accountants, External Brokers, internal Business Development Manager (BDM) and Business Account Manager (BAM) enquiries are responded to in a timely manner.
-	Processing of SCE reports, claim statements, medical certificates and payment reports.
-	Identifying claims that drive and impact premiums, and advising clients and employers how to reduce and managed their premium and claim costs.
-	Advising and educating all relevant parties of their legal liabilities and obligations. 
-	Ensuring all Letters of Authority (LOA) are filed and new brokers details are updated on the IMS data report as well as assigning Intermediary Numbers for each broker.
.

general.headline: Head of People & Culture l Ranked #9 GPTW 2018
general.description:
Leading The Campaign Towards Happier and More fulfilled Employees

As MRE’s Head of People and Culture, Adriarna Nunn encapsulates all of the things that make this award winning business rise head and shoulders above the pack. Consciously subverting the traditionally accepted values of Human Resources and embodying the core values that underscore MRE’s success, her focus is on maximising the engagement, effectiveness and retention of each and every employee. 

With nine years’ experience in the Property industry under her belt, Adriarna is duly acknowledged as a force of nature, juggling myriad roles across the company from recruitment to the induction and development of entry level candidates. Responsible for the overarching well-being of staff, Adriarna actively works with each team member to help formulate their individual professional career blueprints, along with providing ongoing support and guidance for up-skilling. The internal culture of MRE is vital to a cohesive team and Adriarna, operating as a natural motivator with a genuine love of people, is able to employ her innate empathy to ensure everyone is included and valued. 

Adriarna works long coffee fuelled hours at a job she adores, in an environment that often blends business with pleasure, but while socially gregarious, she nonetheless values quality downtime with her partner, family and friends. Inherently civic minded, Adriarna also likes to give back by volunteering with various charities.

jobs.description:
From its inception in 1971, Drake Medox has been the successful health and community care recruitment arm of global organisation, Drake International. In just over 40 years, Drake Medox has grown to be one of the most respected and successful providers of healthcare professionals and homecare support services in Australia.
 
We have offices across the country, and work closely with some of our nation's largest hospitals, medical corporations and facilities in providing nursing, disability support, homecare and allied health staff. We have extensive experience in home and community care, providing support workers for families and individuals who require all levels of support at home or in the community.
 
With our practised team of consultants, coupled with our extensive recruitment, selection and induction process, we offer our clients professional healthcare staff who are available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. All Drake Medox staff are screened, interviewed, referenced checked and are available to work on a casual or contract basis. We also recruit regularly for a wide range of permanent roles. 

Drake Medox is a name synonymous with quality healthcare recruitment, and for the last 40 years, it's a name that many have come to trust and rely on when it comes to staffing and homecare support services.

general.headline: Recruiter - Trades & Technical (Heavy Engineering)  at Drake International
general.description:
I am a Recruitment Professional with 7 years hands on experience in blue collar, trades and white collar Recruitment, Market Surveys and Scheduling in Australia and overseas. In Jun 2012 I joined as a Recruitment Executive at Jobenvoy Pvt Ltd where I was promoted as a Recruitment Resourcer in Dec 2012.

I have gained experience in different areas across various industries. My foundation as a social research interviewer enabled me to expertise in customer handling and customer relationship through dealing with interviews. Thereafter, working as a scheduler allowed me to expertise in the field of customer relations, sales and develop leadership skills in a more precised manner.

Subsequently, after joining as a Recruitment Executive my professional expertise on dealing with people factor has outsized in numerous manner. Providing headhunting and recruitment solutions for many corporate giants has become a unique strength of mine, which allowed me to be the ‘Employee of the year’ in the year 2012

Furthermore I believe my Academic and professional experience along with outsized exposure to the corporate world will facilitate me to take up challenges in the field. I can assure to align with the overall responsibilities.

general.headline: Entrepreneur, Innovator, Coffee Expert, Mechanical Engineer
general.description:
Ziv is a passionate leader and entrepreneur who is striving to make a dent in the universe. Utilizing his technical skills as a mechanical engineer, deep understanding, expertise and experience in the coffee industry, Ziv is driven to propel the specialty coffee industry forward and to make the exquisite specialty coffee experience more accessible around the globe.

As an innovator, Ziv strongly believe in the power of technology and processes automation to make better quality products, more efficient and more precise. Nevertheless, Ziv is also a great advocate for the symbiosis between man and machine and the ability of technology to enhance human skills, reduce and human error.

Consequently, Ziv have founded Coffee Innovations, a Food tech start-up specializing in the design and development of novel technological solutions for the professional coffee industry. Coffee Innovations technology creates the perfect harmony between the espresso machine and its operator in which reduces human error, increases productivity and coffee quality while maintaining the skilful art of the coffee making process.

general.headline: CEO at Swimming Australia
general.description:
An accomplished Executive and Director, Leigh's reputation as a sports leader is built equally on excellence and diversity - as a CEO, consultant, author, leadership & culture lecturer, media performer and vocal advocate for equity in sport.

Leigh was the first woman to hold a senior executive position within an AFL Club (working across football & administration) and the youngest CEO appointed in Netball Victoria’s history.
​
Leigh speaks, writes and coaches on themes that she is passionate about - high performance, team dynamics, leadership & culture, women in sport, diversity and helping people be the best they can be, using strategies she has learned from many years in the sport pressure cooker. 
 
She has authored an online leadership program for women (The Ignition Project), published 'Game On' and owns F45 Training Mornington and The Retreat, a meditation & wellness space. 
 
Leigh also serves as Chair of Tennis Victoria’s Nominations Committee, Chair of Cricket Australia’s Player Welfare Committee, is a former Director of the State Sport Centres Trust and AFL SportsReady, and former Chair of Women’s Health West.
 
She has worked for the Victorian Government, facilitating SRV's Women in Sport & Active Recreation Taskforce and consulted on the current Sport Champions of Change program.
​
Leigh is a professional member of the Australian Institute of Company Directors & the Australian Human Resources Institute. Leigh is also a Myers Briggs Practitioner and an Extended DISC® Accredited Consultant and Trainer.

KOOKAÏ is an Australian owned women’s fashion label (Magi Enterprises Pty Ltd trading as 'KOOKAÏ'​)

The brand is defined by an essence of femininity, confidence, allure and independent style.  The KOOKAÏ collection is designed exclusively out of the Melbourne studio through creative, symbiotic process – whereby we are ever inspired by the KOOKAÏ woman and, in turn, create pieces through which to continually inspire her.
 
The KOOKAÏ Australia and New Zealand story began in 1992 when the founders, Robert Cromb and Danielle Vagner, had a vision to introduce the Parisian label into the lives, and wardrobes, of the Australian woman. The concept was simple: fashionable, high quality pieces at accessible prices.
 
Today, despite over two decades of evolution, KOOKAÏ remains true to its origins in providing a collection infused with Parisian chic, and continuing to provide an opportunity for women to embrace their individuality and the power of expression through their wardrobe.
 
The majority of the KOOKAÏ collection is produced out of our own manufacturing facilities in Fiji, as part of KOOKAÏ’s overall pursuit of an ethical and meaningful existence.
 
Through our 37 boutiques across Australia and New Zealand, Kookai offers a unique shopping experience through which the KOOKAÏ woman can transcend fashion’s boundaries – defying the trends and creating her own.

general.headline: Agency Principal at iBuildNew | Property Investment Strategist | Trusted Advisor
general.description:
Rob Puzzolo is the Agency Principal of iBuildNew, is hands-on and involved in every aspect of the real estate agency. He leads a team of property experts, manages partner relationships and runs solution based advisory education. Advisory is tailored and exclusive for partner clients to share knowledge, educate and build wealth through property investment. 
Rob has over 15 years of experience in residential property, sales management and strategic project marketing. Since entering the real estate industry, Rob developed significant well-rounded experience in property investment, renovating to flip, building, off the plan home & land sales, land sales, residential real estate and project sales. 
In the Melbourne real estate market Rob is trusted among colleagues and clients alike, he draws on extensive experience and provided guidance to thousands of clients to successfully achieve home ownership and property investment. Renowned for his integrity, professionalism, possessing a personable character and is committed to offering clients the highest quality representation. 
Previously as Sales Manager CBRE Residential Projects, Rob was responsible for leading Melbourne's largest residential project sales team, coaching, mentoring and motivating sales personnel to achieve peak performance. He was responsible for managing the sales team, vendor relationships and delivering record sales success in over 45 residential developments. During this time CBRE became the first agency ever in Australia to sell over 1,000 apartments in a single development branded Australia 108 the tallest building in the Southern Hemisphere, culminating with CBRE winning the prestigious RICS Award (Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors Oceania) as the Residential Team of the Year 2015.
Rob is a Licensed Estate Agent, has a Certificate IV in Property Services (Real Estate) and also a Certificate IV in Workplace Training & Assessment.
