general.headline: CEO at One Roof | Expert on Female Entrepreneurship | Co-working | Accelerators | Facilitator & Coach | Startup Advisor
general.description:
Free-spirited former lawyer Sheree loves to shake things up and challenge old ways of thinking which is forever leading to new and exciting opportunities. In her former life as a lawyer at one of Australia's top tier commercial law firms Sheree was famous for her ability to bring life and culture to the everyday - helping to coordinate a company flash mob was just one of her many achievements. 

Sheree is a passionate advocate for helping women to build meaningful careers and thriving businesses. With an understanding of the specific needs, challenges and ambitions of female entrepreneurs Sheree co-founded One Roof. A multi-national company across Australia and the United States, One Roof curates industry-first female centric co-working spaces and provides the support and resources entrepreneurial women need to thrive. 

Sheree is a career strategist, business coach and facilitator. She has extensive experience organising and hosting intimate and large-scale women's focused networking events. As a volunteer with Fitted for Work, Sheree mentors women who experience disadvantage to become financially independent.  

Sheree was awarded the 2016 Victorian Young Achievers Leadership Award. She was nominated as one of Australia’s top young innovators for the Foundation for Young Australian's Young Social Pioneers program and won a pitching competition with a $10,000 seed funding award. She was also selected two years in a row as one of the only Australians to attend a social entrepreneurship leadership program funded by the Schusterman Family Foundation and hosted in Israel. 

Sheree completed a bachelor of Law and Arts (Media and Communications) at the University of Melbourne. Sheree is a qualified Legal Practitioner and a Certified Practitioner of Neuro Linguistic Programming (NLP), Hypnosis, Time Line Therapy(R) and NLP Coaching. Sheree is a graduate from the School of Social Entrepreneurs.

jobs.description:
One Roof converts unique, under-utilised and dormant spaces into buzzing hubs for female entrepreneurship. One Roof Melbourne is located in Southbank and is currently home to over 65 women led businesses across all industries including tech, digital marketing, PR, health & event management. More than just a well curated female centric co-working space One Roof provides the tools, resources & support female entrepreneurs need to thrive under one roof. We support entrepreneurs in the three key areas if mind, body & business and this includes business coaching, networking events, mentorship, accelerator programs, yoga & meditation. 
One Roof is a global brand with a presence in Melbourne, Sydney, Los Angeles & New York. 
www.oneroofwomen.com

We’re About To Blow Up Business For Women

The FBomb is a unique YouTube program pilot for women in business. 

The Problem 
Our experience tells us that many women running their own business feel alone and isolated in their journey. They watch others on social media who appear to be having huge success and feel inferior and deflated because their business isn’t an overnight success. They often feel overwhelmed and exhausted by the constant hustle to get ahead. This impacts their mindset and motivation. We also know that women struggle with confidence and courage to ask for what they want and take risks.  

Our Solution 
We seek to normalise real conversations amongst women in business and talk about what actually goes on behind the scenes for all of us. We want to dig deep into the difference between perception and reality in business for women. Our aim is to bring the unspoken stuff out into the open to help women know that they are not alone and work through the challenges they face in business in a way that is constructive and conducive to sustainability and growth. Jump on over to Facebook and like the FBOMB page, you won't want to miss he excitement that is building around this unique concept.  https://www.facebook.com/TheF8ombShow/

Facilitating career acceleration programs and personal branding masterclasses.
      
      Offering strategy and one-on-one coaching sessions.

Writing articles and assisting with the launch of Rosie. 

Rosie is an online platform where young women can connect with the best web resources out there, helping them to navigate life’s tricky situations. Rosie has a range of tips, links and videos all centred around a theme of respect – for your body & mind, in your relationships, at work and for the world we live in. Rosie believes young women have the courage and resilience to change our world for the better.

Fitted For Work is a not-for-profit organisation with a vision of financial independence for women and a mission to help women experiencing disadvantage get work and keep it. 

I coordinate and assist with marketing, fundraising, communications, social media exposure, content design for the monthly newsletter and grant writing.

Young Vagabond is a new digital magazine that launched last year for young women
      and provides a positive alternative to traditional women's magazines. I am currently
      
      managing the blog and occasionally writing articles for the magazine.

general.headline: Blockchain and Cryptocurrency Advisor
general.description:
Passionate entrepueneur, educator and community leader in the Bitcoin and Blockchain ecosystem. 

I've successfully exited a Bitcoin business, helped raise $5.9m for a Blockchain mining company and managed the development of the world's first Blockchain knowledge hub and coworking space, Blockchain Centre. As of January 2018, we now have centres in Melbourne, Shanghai and Vilnius Lithuania. 

I apply my deep understanding and experience of business and the real world applications of blockchain technology facilitating education workshops and hosting industry events to ensure the company and its supported not for profit co working space meets its long-term strategic goal of developing and maintaining leadership in the blockchain industry. 

I have 15 years professional experience in consumer and business sales with over 6 years experience in the Telco Sales Industry, majority of this time spent in sales team management to a national level, responsible for annual sales revenue of $24 million.

I have been interviewed twice on Triple J's drivetime radio show, Sky News Business, ABCs radio show 'Known and Unknown' and in press articles for The Australian, AFR, Sydney Morning Herald, Finance Magnates, Daily Express UK, News.com.au, Finder.com, The Constant Investor, Southbank Local News and a host of global Bitcoin and Blockchain industry specific publications and YouTube channels.

jobs.description:
Business Development Manager at Creation Homes in Victoria

Creation Homes Victoria is a builder of Top Quality Turn Key Town Homes and H & L Properties for the wholesale market both nationally and internationally and is a subsidiary and backed by Metro Property Development which is also one of the top Builder/Developers of residential Towers and Apartments in Australia.

With an extensive background in both land and town homes developments from conception to completion during more than 11 years working for two of the of the top sales & marketing companies in the industry being Oliver Hume and Red23. This has provided me with great knowledge of the industry and an expansive network of Sales Professionals/Builders and Developers that I have worked with in the Greenfields space.

The opportunity presented itself to expand this knowledge base further when of the last properties of the development that I was working within and the BDM role for a reputable and highly respected builder was a great opportunity to step up. This allowed me to use my knowledgebase and network to take this position from where it was to a higher level and raise the bar working in the B2B side of the industry.

Current Responsibilities 
- Procure & secure development opportunities with H & L as well as Medium Density Sites
- Manage and grow an extensive database in excess of 500+ channels
- Network with industry professionals on the procuring side including but not limited to Land Vendors, Developers, Sales & Marketing Companies and Sales Agents
- Network with industry professionals on the selling side including but not limited to Wealth Creation Companies, Financial Planners, Mortgage Brokers, Real Estate Agents and Investment Companies
- Locate opportunities for Creation Homes sourcing town house sites, joint ventures, land to purchase, land to package and new channels to work with to market our properties
- Manage a deal from reservation through to settlement
- Provide exceptional service

Currently the Estate Manager of Summerhill Estate in North Epping & The Woods Estate in Mickleham

I receive great satisfaction managing multi-million dollar developments and successfully selling and exceeding the budgets and target KPI's set. 

Selling Real Estate be it Land, home or both I believe the purchase experience is of the highest priority and should be an enjoyable and informative experience, this is shown frequently as previous purchasers seek me out when friends & family or themselves are back in the market for a property. 

I have a strong work ethic and look to increase efficiency where I see the ability to improve in any area, my enjoyment of challenges and my reputation have allowed me to work in some of the most prestigious developments throughout Melbourne.

I have a thirst for knowledge and seek out for furthering my skill set, I have high personal expectations and work hard to achieve the results with all I am involved in. 

I enjoying working within a team and am passionate about what I do, I have a great deal to offer and enjoy assisting others in their learning and to achieve above their expectation and forming good habits to be successful.

Experience
- Land Sales including new and existing developments and golfing communities deposit to settlement
- Medium Density Sales deposit to settlement
- Townhouse Development Sales where I was in charge of both the land and the house sales through the deposit, contractual, variations and the settlement and handover process

- Taking leads from initial enquiry through to the after sales service

- Reporting to my management and directors through to the directors and managers of the developer of my current project including weekly developer meetings to discuss the development and action moving forward and maintaining a good relationship

 ✔	Leading change management and other growth-oriented projects, largely founded on HR disciplines.
 ✔	Training and developing all levels of staff, including empowering store managers to effectively lead.
 ✔	Monitoring all learning and organisational development programs, incl. performance management.
 ✔	Ensuring L&OD and other HR-related processes complied with company policy and industry 
        standards.
 ✔	Analysing and reporting on performance management trends and results, advising senior 
       executives.

Key Achievements:

 ✔	Enhanced performance of people particularly new starters, introducing a comprehensive half-day induction program that engaged employees, strengthened compliance and promoted company values.
 ✔	Assured organisational commitment to performance management, maintaining contact including via L&OD with all staff including store managers, to establish customer-oriented learning environments.
 ✔	Broadened opportunity to effectively engage with employees, including via creation of a quarterly internal newsletter where trademark key messages were reiterated and all people updates provided.

Laurent Bakery Group is a family owned bakery boasting over 15 stores and 650 staff across Melbourne and Sydney. Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer I was responsible for establishing and management of HR framework for the group.

Key Contributions: 

✔	Designing and implementing L&D programs and HR frameworks aligned with policies and regulations.
✔	Providing specialist advice including conflict resolution and stress management from a HR perspective.
✔	Conducting comprehensive needs analysis to deliver multi-staff coaching and training opportunities.
✔	Establishing and improving on current company policies, including OH&S and return-to-work protocol.
✔	Introducing employee engagement solutions including inductions and performance management tools.
✔	Resolving complex ER and other people issues, founded on effective relationship building capabilities.

Key Achievements:

✔	Effected high-performing, culturally attuned personnel, including integrating recruitment and retention systems that attracted top talent, equipped new starters and encouraged career progression. 
✔	Escalated revenue growth across the multiple sites, rolling out a sales-driven leadership program that strengthened store managers’ output – helped establish clearer customer service practices and targets. 
✔	Enabled long-term retention of international talent, working closely with internal people as well as external immigration personnel to secure 457 visa/immigration permits for 15+ full-time employees.

Gopoint is a construction and consultancy business based in Muscat Oman. I was brought into this business to run all HR aspects of the company. 

Key Contributions: 

 ✔	Designing and implementing tools and systems to support company-wide learning and development.
 ✔	Enhancing the company’s culture by demonstrating behavioural competencies and encouraging others. 
 ✔	Applying and explaining legislation and procedures including HR policies to all staff including managers. 
 ✔	Initiating recruitment processes to suit the company’s project dynamics and overall strategic direction. 
 ✔	Managing complex ER and other staffing issues, delivering specialist advice (e.g. return to work 
 policy).

Key Achievements:

 ✔ Introduced a new applicant tracking process from headcount approval to commencement. I process mapped the candidate journey and experience to ensure candidates were compliant. The process also assisted managers to track probation and any further training requirements.
  ✔	Met all organisational capabilities requirements, establishing L&OD strategies and HR-oriented policies (e.g. construction recruitment) that accommodated short- and long-term business projections.
 ✔	Assured compliance & cohesion among project teams, effectively process mapping the job candidate journey and introducing a 90-page induction handbook that was tailored to country-specific legislation.
 ✔	Contributed to the business’s long-term sustainability, setting a strategic direction including via performance management metrics and redesigning team structures that helped improve productivity.

Portmans is a fashion brand with over 110 stores in Australia and New Zealand. In this role I was accountable and managed the recruitment process for key positions and senior executive appointments for the company.

general.headline: Founder: Token Launchers | Co-owner: BlockchainDeveloper.com
general.description:
Token Launchers – The people behind the ICO... 

I'm an experienced filmmaker from The United States and Australia, based in London, though currently right now I'm filming in Melbourne Australia. If you're in the entertainment industry and want to connect and or collaborated send me connection request.

I'm a crypto and blockchain film producer, currently doing short films and documentaries about Token Launchers – The people behind the ICO. My new production company for short films and documentaries about ICO Token Launchers is aptly called Token Launchers.

I just started a LinkedIn group, also called Token Launchers. So if the shoe fits, please join me there.

https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13604374

If you've already done a successful ICO, or are launching one now, get in touch if you would like for me to do a segment, short film or documentary about your ICO project and the Token Launchers behind it.  

My family owns Blockchain Developer (BlockchainDeveloper.com). We have one of the largest blockchain developer teams in the world. So if you need anything in blockchain done, you know who to call. 

I'm very enthusiastic about the things which can be done with blockchain and smart contracts. 

I like cryptocurrencies like: Bitcoin, Litecoin, Bitcoin Cash, but I'm most excited about blockchain protocols, smart contracts, dApps, Ethereum / ETH / ERC-20), EOS, NEO, Stellar, Cardano, IOTA, NEM, ICON and privacy coins like Monero , Dash and Zcash, can't forget those. 

I have three sisters who are women in blockchain and co-founders of the CryptoFemmes - Women in Blockchain Alliance.  So I'm a really big supporter of women in blockchain and women in cryptocurrency.  

If you're into film, crypto or both lets connect and maybe we can collaborate. 

If I really like a project, I can be very helpful as an advisor, influencer, brand ambassador and advocate. So if you're doing something amazing and want me to be part of it, let me know so I can take a look.

jobs.description:
Token Launchers is about all the people who are doing all the things which make token launching possible.

Join the Token Launchers community group here:
https://www.linkedin.com/groups/13604374/

My own primary interest as a token launcher is creating short films, documentaries and program segments about ICO token launchers.

I've combined my passions for video & film production and animation with blockchain & cryptocurrency which resulted in Token Launchers, and me wanting to build a community to celebrate all of us who are in the token launching space.

I'm doing my own film projects in the Bitcoin, blockchain, cryptocurrency and ICO space, but my production crew and I are available for hire too for any legitimate ICO token launch. 

I realized that contributors and investors are far more comfortable if they have sense of who the people are behind a token launch. ICO founder videos are valuable. Even better when most of team are in one location is to do a short documentary about them as the token launchers behind the ICO. It can also be done in a reality TV style, or an artist style. It really depends on what matches the project best. 

The goal is for an audience to connect with and like the people who are doing an ICO token launch, or who have already done one. It's really about establishing good public relations.

Token Developer a sister company of Blockchain Developer (BlockchainDeveloper.com). Token Developer provides services for ICO token launches. Including white paper writing and evaluation, ICO website design and development, technical review, token creation and smart contract development for the Pre-ICO, ICO and Post-ICO stages.

Token Developer
TokenDeveloper.com
http://tokendeveloper.com

Blockchain Developer (BlockchainDeveloper.com) can create or build pretty much anything you can imagine which is related to blockchain. We can also help connect existing platforms and systems to one, or more blockchains. 

We can do a blockchain project for you, or provide you with your own team of blockchain developers for your project. Whether you need one or one hundred blockchain developers we can help you. 

Are you wanting a blockchain wallet, or cryptocurrency exchange? No problem, we have experience with crypto exchanges, because we've done them before. We're currently building seven more cryptocurrency exchanges. Four which are centralized cryptocurrency exchanges and three which are decentralized cryptocurrency exchanges. 

We have one of the largest groups of experienced blockchain technology experts. Many who are now blockchain specialist for one of the many blockchain protocols.

Contact us if you would like to have blockchain explained so you can better understand how blockchain technology can benefit your business, company or institution.  We are also open to discussing strategic alliances. 

Our blockchain group keeps up to date with blockchain news & blockchain info so we can see what blockchain trends are coming as they are forming. 

I'm currently in Melbourne, Australia. If you want to meet up with me here, or maybe at a  blockchain expo, conference or event — message me.

Blockchain Developer

I work best with people who are smart and savvy and know that with my professional assistance, they will be able to learn new skills, take action and achieve results.

Based in Melbourne or online via video call.

Biography

Sue Ellson BBus MIML MAHRI CDAA ASA MPC WV was born in Adelaide and moved to Melbourne in 1994. She joined LinkedIn on 21 December 2003 and is one of the first 80,000 people in the world on the platform. She has been consulting on the topic of LinkedIn since 2008 and launched her first three 80,000 word  books in 2016.

She has a background in banking, training, recruitment, HR, marketing, employment, websites and social media and her first website, Newcomers Network.com went online in 2001. She created Camberwell Network.com in 2012 and 120 Ways Publishing in 2015.

She is currently an Independent LinkedIn Specialist and Career Development Practitioner providing consulting and training on the topics of LinkedIn, social media and marketing to individual clients and organisations worldwide. She also provides a variety of LinkedIn and Career Advice services for local and international companies, teaches at two educational facilities and provides business consulting services to private clients internationally.

Sue enjoys 5 Rhythms dancing too!

general.headline: Managing Director at Onehalf Australia Outsourcing Services
general.description:
With an accounting  degree, my practical experience has been broad ranging and high-impact.  From crunching the numbers, strategy consulting, project management and business transformation within large private and public companies. Starting from humble beginnings in the hospitality industry, before going on to becoming an accountant and then working for large publicly listed businesses in senior finance roles.

I have worked into all areas of management in all areas covering Finance, Operations, Sales  before having the opportunity to start Total Logistics Solutions.

I am an experienced company director and executive with over 28 years’ experience and over 16 as director and founder of multiple successful high turnover companies. I am currently the Managing Director of Total Logistics Solutions, a large logistics company with a national service reach, delivering to all main cities daily.

I am also managing director of Onehalf which is national business process offshoring organisation that combines the best people, processes and technology to deliver quality business solutions to customers across Australia using highly trained people located in the Philippines. 

The combination of both these diverse businesses has allowed me to oversee and execute strategy for a diverse range of organisations in most sectors.  There is not much that I haven't seen or done before when it comes to business transformation.

One of my main strengths is building confidence within teams through positive, energetic and clear communication and empowerment and results. I place a very high regard in achieving strategic outcomes through common purpose and inspiring and motivating with my inclusive approach to management.
